title: Dspace HIL Rig Developer
description:
We are looking for a Senior HIL Engineer/Test Rig Developer with dSpace expertise. You will join an innovative team working with thermal and climate system verification.
  
Job Description
  
Are you a highly skilled HIL Development Engineer, who is passionate about technology and innovation.
  
The work is done in close collaboration with SW development teams, system verification team and other functions, so you need to be skilled in working in a cross-functional and international environment.
  
* Verification of complex electrical systems in regards of functionality, performance and safety.
* Increasing automation of testing procedures.
* Development of test methods and test requirements.
* Developing our ways of working within climate/thermal area.
* Planning, performing, reporting and following up of verification deliverables.


**Experience required:**  

* Hands-on experience of HIL verification and rig development
* You should have an M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, Mechatronics or similar relevant education
* Experience of System Verification
* minimum 5 years of work experience in the automotive industry
* Experience from commercial vehicle is meriting


**Skills required:**  

* Expert in dSpace tools (Automation desk, configuration desk, Control desk),
* Matlab/Simulink, C++, Python, Jira, SystemWeaver, CANalyzer, and/or SE-Tool is a plus.
* Excellent communication- and collaboration skills
* Curious, and driven team player.
* Passionate about knowledge sharing
* Fluent in English both spoken and written

title: Driven Javautvecklare inom testautomation & CI
description:
Om företaget
  
Avaron AB är ett konsultbolag som erbjuder specialistkompetens inom IT och utveckling. Vi arbetar med varierande uppdrag åt kunder inom olika branscher och värdesätter ett nära samarbete, kvalitet i leveranser samt en positiv arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas i din yrkesroll och samtidigt bidra med din expertis i spännande uppdrag.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
I detta konsultuppdrag kommer du att arbeta hos en av våra kunder i Stockholm. Din primära uppgift är att vidareutveckla och effektivisera processer för testautomation och Continuous Integration (CI). Du samarbetar nära andra utvecklare och testingenjörer samt använder verktyg som Eclipse/IntelliJ, Maven, Jenkins och JIRA för att säkerställa hög leveranskvalitet.
  
Du får ett stort ansvar att förbättra de befintliga testprocesserna och att bidra med nya idéer för både tekniska lösningar och arbetsmetoder. Rollen innebär även att du arbetar aktivt med att integrera testautomation i CI/CD-pipelines för att skapa en stabil och effektiv utvecklingsmiljö.
  
Kvalifikationer (Ska-krav)
  
3–7 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
  
Erfarenhet av testautomation och CI/CD-pipelines
  
Kunskap i Eclipse eller IntelliJ, Maven, Jenkins och JIRA
  
Möjlighet att arbeta på plats i Stockholm
  
Flytande svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)
  
Möjlighet att genomgå och godkännas i en säkerhetsprövning nivå 2 (kräver svenskt medborgarskap)
  
  

Meriterande (Bra att ha)
  
Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila utvecklingsteam
  
Förståelse för DevOps-principer och molnlösningar
  
Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling (TDD) eller andra testmetodiker
  
  

Ansökan
  
Våra tjänster kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, då vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att söka så snart som möjligt.
  
Skicka din ansökan i form av personligt brev och CV till jobb@avaron.se.
  
Märk mejlet med ”Driven Javautvecklare inom testautomation & CI (ID 12946)”.
  
Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Junior Software Developer
description:
Did you recently graduated with a master degree in Software Engineering and want to work with Software Development for In-Car Solutions? Our client is now looking for a junior Software Developer interested in working with modern technical solutions and software deliveries to customers.

 **Working as a Software Developer**  

Our client is seeking a talented and collaborative Software Developer to join their growing team in Lund. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge "In-Car Solutions" used by professionals such as emergency services personnel. The team will be a part of "The Body Worn software organization" and will be focusing on in-car solutions, as well as colloboating with the teams focusing on body worn cameras, mobile apps and services.

**Your key responsibilites:**

  

* Together with your team, develop and maintain Windows-based video management solutions for car-mounted cameras
* Write code primarily in C# and .NET, with occasional work in Go and C
* Participate in agile development processes with a focus on quality and customer feedback
* Contribute to pilot installations and work directly with customers to gather insights


The location for this role is in Lund, Sweden.

**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**  

Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at the client in Lund starting in january.  

You will be coached by a mentor at our client and by a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of.  

  

**Desired qualifications:**

  

* Programming skills in C# and .NET
* Master’s degree in Computer Science
* Familiarity with Go is a plus
* Experience with Windows-based software development
* Familiar with wireless and wired communication protocols such as Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GPS, and CAN bus
* Team player with excellent communication skills
* Interest in working closely with customers and incorporating their feedback
* For this position we need someone with a master degree in computer science or information technology

**Application**  

Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter **Lema Naderi** at **lema.naderi@nexergroup.com**  

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

**About Nexer Tech Talent**  

*Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent* *here*

title: Utvecklare till Webcur
description:
### **Vi är på en spännande resa inom e-hälsa och behöver förstärka vårt team med en utvecklare som delar vår vision om en vård fri från administration.**


Utvecklingen av Webcur påbörjades våren 2021 och har som mål att bli ett komplett journalsystem för den tyska marknaden.

### **Om rollen**


Som utvecklare i ett av våra tvärfunktionella team kommer du att arbeta med utvecklingen av vårt webbaserade journalsystem **Webcur**, en produkt som bidrar till en mer effektiv och säker vård. Produkten är byggd med **Kotlin i backend** och **React/TypeScript i frontend** och driftas på en **containerbaserad molnplattform**. Eftersom patientsäkerhet är central i våra produkter och vi hanterar mycket känslig data, är det viktigt att du värdesätter höga krav på kvalitet och driftsäkerhet.


Vi ser stora fördelar med **tvärfunktionellt samarbete, kundfokus, snabba flöden, korta återkopplingscykler och iterativa utvecklingsmetoder**. Vi uppmuntrar till **samarbetsinriktat arbete** och förväntar oss att teamen delar ansvar för både arbete och resultat gemensamt. Därför söker vi dig som trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra och som har erfarenhet av att jobba i denna typ av miljö.


Vi värdesätter högt om du som utvecklare **vill vara aktiv i produktutforskarfasen och bidra till att förstå kundens behov och affärsdomänen**. Det är viktigt att du vill bidra till att vi når våra gemensamma mål, som alla ligger i linje med vår vision om en vård fri från administration.

### **Din profil**


Vi tror att du har **några års arbetslivserfarenhet som Kotlin- eller Java-utvecklare**. Det är inget krav, men en fördel om du har erfarenhet av utveckling i större system. Vi är dock övertygade om att erfarenhet till viss del kan uppnås genom **nyfikenhet och en vilja att lära**.


Nyfikenhet, kvalitet, innovation, engagemang och ärlighet är egenskaper som kännetecknar Carasent Sveriges organisation och kultur. Därför tror vi att detta även speglas i dig.

#### **Krav på erfarenhet:**


Erfarenhet av **Kotlin eller Java**  

Erfarenhet av **Spring Boot**  

Erfarenhet av **SQL / Databaser**  

Van vid att **testa din kod**  

Erfarenhet av och intresse för **agila värderingar, principer och arbetssätt**  

Språkkunskaper i **svenska eller engelska**

#### **Meriterande erfarenhet:**


Erfarenhet av **medicintekniska system eller sjukvård**  

Erfarenhet av **samarbetsinriktad utveckling (Pair Programming/Software Teaming)**  

**Testdriven utveckling (TDD)**  

Kunskap inom**Kubernetes**  

**Continuous Integration & Delivery** (Trunk-based Development)  

**Frontendutveckling (JavaScript/React/TypeScript/CSS)**  

Kunskaper i **tyska**

### **Vi erbjuder**


Hos oss står **välmående i fokus**, och vi erbjuder förmåner såsom:  

**Träning på arbetstid**  

**Friskvårdsbidrag och sjukvårdsförsäkring**  

**Personalaktiviteter**  

**"Vision days" (utvecklingsdagar)**


Carasent erbjuder en **hybrid arbetsplats**, vilket ger dig flexibilitet i hur du fördelar din arbetstid. Vi ser dock gärna att alla kollegor träffas regelbundet på kontoret – och för den som vill finns möjlighet att vara på plats **varje dag i veckan**.

### **Om Carasent**


Carasent är **förankrat i visionen om att möjliggöra framtidens vård**. Vi erbjuder vårdgivare **ett sömlöst ekosystem av integrerade lösningar** som avsevärt **minskar administrativa bördor och förbättrar patientengagemang och vårdleverans**.


Med en bred produktportfölj, inklusive **molnbaserade journalsystem, digitala patientkommunikationstjänster, BI-lösningar och integrationer med partners**, erbjuder Carasent idag **den mest flexibla affärsstödet för klinisk verksamhet i Norden**.


Carasent har kontor i **Sverige, Tyskland och Norge** och har kunder inom **primärvård, specialistvård, företagshälsovård och rehabilitering**, framför allt inom den privata sektorn.

### **Ansökan och bakgrundskontroll**


Innan en anställning kan bli aktuell kommer en **bakgrundskontroll att genomföras**. Vi använder bakgrundskontroller från **SRI**.


**För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef:** joakim.bring@carasent.com

### **Nyfiken? Skicka in din ansökan!**


**Vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan på svenska eller engelska!**  

Vi tillämpar **löpande urval**, och annonsen är öppen tills tjänsten är tillsatt.

title: R&D Engineer - Embedded Software developer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0053164
**Date Posted:**

2025-02-26
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

Hitachi Energy revolutionized the transmission of electricity over long distances with minimal losses over 60 years ago by introducing High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology. Today, HVDC can deliver up to 12 gigawatts of power at voltage levels reaching 1,100 kV, covering distances of over 3,000 kilometres. In the heart of HVDC station, the Modular Advanced Control for High performance (MACH™) system plays a vital role in achieving successful results. MACH™ offers unparalleled calculation capacity and facilitates seamless integration and control of all functions related to protection and control. Additionally, MACH™ control provides advanced fault registration and remote-control capabilities. Designed to operate continuously for thirty years or more, the MACH™ system ensures reliable control and protection of the HVDC system throughout its lifespan.


As a member of the R&D team in the MACH Products unit, you will collaborate with a diverse group of talented engineers from around the world. Working within the SAFe framework, you will contribute to the development of the next generation MACH™ system and maintain both new and existing legacy systems.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Engage in the development and maintenance of wide range of embedded systems (ARM, DSP, SoC...), from pre-study and design to tests and integration.
* Develop high-quality software modules within specified timelines and efficiently maintain them, including implementing enhancements and bug fixes.
* Create specifications and documentation for software components.
* Ensure code quality through code reviews, test automation, and adherence to up-to-date software development processes.
* Collaborate with internal and external customers working in agile, cross-competent teams.
* Uphold Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity by taking responsibility for your actions and showing care for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* 5+ years of work experience in relevant role and field.
* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Electronics, or Electrical Engineering.
* Profound engineering background in **embedded software development** using **C/C++** on multi-processor systems.
* Overview in **electronics** , FPGA/VHDL to also partner with hardware and FPGA designers in the team.
* Experience with relevant development environments and software tools such as **real time operating systems, microcontroller architecture, GIT, Dev Ops, TFS, static code analysis** etc.
* Knowledge of **C#** and communication protocols like **CAN and EtherCAT** would be advantageous.
* Excellent **English** presentation skills.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**Additional information**

Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you!


Welcome to apply by March 25th! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis so the sooner you show your interest the better.


More information: Recruiting Manager Remia Menon , remia.menon@hitachienergy.com , will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Gustaf Hedström, gustaf.hedstrom@hitachienergy.com


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Teamcenter Developer
description:

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**About the Role:** As a Siemens Teamcenter Developer, you will be responsible for developing and customizing solutions within the Siemens Teamcenter environment. You will work closely with the development team to ensure solutions meet business requirements and adhere to best practices in PLM (Product Lifecycle Management).


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and customize Teamcenter solutions using both configuration and custom code/scripts.
* Perform ITK server-side programming in C/C++, Java for dispatcher clients, and XML for stylesheet definitions.
* Utilize tools such as BMIDE, Workflow Designer, and Query Builder for continuous development.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in existing code based on user or team reports.
* Support the development team with technical expertise in programming.
* Incorporate PLM/Teamcenter development best practices.
* Integrate Teamcenter solutions with third-party applications such as SAP4Hana, NX, and ECAD tools.
* Configure and customize Active Workspace and Teamcenter architecture/data model.
Install and configure 2-Tier & 4-Tier clients, file management servers, dispatcher servers, and CAD integrations.  
* 

**Required Qualifications:**

* Proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: C/C++, C#, Java, or XML/XSLT.
* Strong knowledge of Teamcenter APIs and the Dispatcher framework.
* Experience with Active Workspace configuration and customization.
* Familiarity with Git (Azure DevOps) for code management.
* Understanding of Teamcenter UA products, including Engineering Data Management, BOM Management, Workflow, and Change Management.
* Experience in Teamcenter client-server customization and SOA customization.
* Basic problem-solving skills for application issues and root cause analysis.
* Exposure to real-time customer environments and implementation of Teamcenter product solutions.
Proficiency in English; additional languages such as Swedish are highly valued.  
* 

**Good to Have:**

* Experience with Product Configurator, Multi BOM Management, Service BOM, or Supplier Collaboration in TC and AWC latest versions.
Knowledge of transitioning from RAC to AWC, understanding the TC AWC data model and Multi BOM Management capabilities.  
* 

**Personal Attributes:**

* Self-motivated and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly at all levels of the organization.
* Creative mindset with excellent problem-solving abilities.
Natural leadership qualities and the ability to resolve issues efficiently.  
* 

**Why Join Us:**

* Be part of an international team where you can exchange knowledge with colleagues from around the world.
* Work on cutting-edge PLM solutions and contribute to innovative projects.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.

title: Software Security Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss**

  

Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjlighet att jobba med branchexperter och samhällsviktiga tjänster. Vi utvecklar och förvaltar säkra system och lösningar för våra kunder. Våra konsulter arbetar med allt från infrastruktur och DevOps till avancerad systemutveckling – där säkerhet och assurans genomsyrar allt. Nu utökar vi vårt team med fler Software Security Developers.

 **Att jobba som Software Security Developer på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:**

* hjälper utvecklingsteam eller utvecklare med det mesta relaterat till applikationssäkerhet
* sätter upp användning av säkerhetsverktyg i pipelines
* förklarar findings i säkerhetsverktyg (kanske kopplat till OWASP Top 10)
* involverad i genomförande av hotmodelleringar
* granskar säkerheten i applikationer eller molnmiljöer
* hjälper till att utveckla eller skripta mindre komponenter


För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.


Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde åt våra kunder. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.

 **För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har förståelse för kombinationen av utveckling och säkerhet**

  

* Kan du exempelvis Java, C# eller Python?
* Har du 3-5 års arbetslivserfarenhet och en utbildning inom systemutveckling eller likvärdigt?
* Behärskar du svenska i tal och skrift?

 ***Varmt välkommen med din ansökan ️***

 **Om oss**


Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.

 **Vi satsar på dig**


Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du ges mängder med möjligheter att fortsätta utvecklas.


På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.


Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.

title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 If you're a Senior Backend Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Company Description** 




 Zaver is a fast-growing fintech based in Stockholm. At Zaver, we develop innovative payment solutions to accelerate the revolution of size-agnostic frictionless payments in the underserved markets. The vision is bold, and in the long run we aim to build an ecosystem of AI-powered financial products.
 



  





 We’re passionate about new technologies and customer experiences. We work hard to challenge the legacy giants in our industry and now we’re starting to see the result of all the hard work. We launched Zaver for Business in 2019 and since then we have gone from 0 to billions of EUR in transaction volume. Today, lighthouse brands such as Porsche, Loewe, Doktor.se and Sweef have put their trust in our solutions.
 



  





 We are backed by some of the most prominent investors in the region, most of which are either founders of unicorns themselves, or backers of unicorns.
 



  





 Right now, the mothership is taking off and we’re therefore looking for customer-obsessed all-star players to join our team.
 



  





**Job Description** 




 Whether you have several years of experience or if you are relatively new to the industry does not matter much to us; we are looking for the right person for the role and will adapt the position accordingly. No job is too big or too small.
 



  





 You’ll play an essential role in developing the Zaver payments platform with next-generation products and features. Your work on the code base will in the matter of hours be live and affect the whole customer base. You’ll need to be able to work with everything from credit risk assessment and our in-house developed banking back office platform, to customer-facing front-ends with instant effect - and everything in between.
 



  





 Needless to say, you possess the skills required to be part of an efficient tech team revolutionizing the durables segment in a fast-paced environment.
 



  
 



**What You'll Do** 



* Become friends with Amazon Web Services.
* Take part in different stages of the product life cycle: design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
* Collaborate with designers and other professionals on large- and small-scale projects.



  





 You will work in close collaboration with amazing people, use new technology and break new ground in the payments space by shipping products far better than anything else in the market.  
 



  





**Requirements** 



* At least 3 years’ experience in a similar role
* Javascript / Typescript
* Angular / React / Vue / Svelte
* CSS
* Cypress / Jasmine
* REST-API



  





**Additional Information**

 Let’s challenge legacy solutions together and make some waves within payments. ⚡
 



  





**How To Apply** 




 Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English.
 



 Our selection process is continuous and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.
 



  
 



**Start:** 
  Immediately with regard to any notice period

title: Front-end Software Engineer
description:
SRS Group är ett svenskt säkerhetsföretag som hanterar konsultativa och operativa säkerhetstjänster för företag, myndigheter och privatpersoner. SRS är auktoriserat av Länsstyrelsen att bedriva och utbilda i personskydd. Våra tjänster omfattar även analys, utredningar och risk- och krishantering.
   

  

 SRS Security (SRS) söker en Front-end Software Engineer för utveckling av verktyg för leveranser av tjänster inom Security Risk Management.
   

  

 Som utvecklare på SRS är det din uppgift att skapa våra tjänster från grunden och ansvara för underhållet för dessa över tid. Det innebär bland annat ett löpande arbete med att kontinuerligt förbättra och härda våra system.
   

  

 I rollen som Front-end Software Engineer kommer du vara SRS expert inom front-end och ha stor rörelsefrihet när det kommer till framtagning av lösningar och implementation av dessa. Du kommer ha direkt kontakt med interna beställare och i dialog inneha en nyckelroll i skapandet av moderna, responsiva och användarvänliga gränssnitt.
   

  

 SRS är verksamt inom hela säkerhetsdomänen och utvecklingsteamet behöver utifrån en god förståelse för de olika affärsenheternas arbetsflöden i kombination med affärsnytta bygga lösningar som genererar maximalt värde.
   

  

 Rollen är baserad i Stockholm (hybridarbete är möjligt).
   

  

 Vem du är
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ och har en professionell framtoning i kombination med fokus på front-end utveckling. Du har vana att arbeta både självständigt och som del av ett team. Du gillar utmaningar, arbetar gärna agilt samt trivs med att ha dokumentation och testning som en del av din vardag. Du har erfarenhet av beställarkontakt och kravinsamling.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som utvecklare på SRS behöver du värdera ansvar högt och vara självgående. Du är lösningsorienterad, engagerad och håller dig uppdaterad på nya trender och tekniker. Du skriver strukturerad kod med säkerhet i fokus och har ett intresse av IT-säkerhet.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Minst 3-4 års arbetserfarenhet med fokus på front-end
* Stark expertis inom React, TypeScript, CSS och moderna UI-ramverk
* Djupgående kunskap inom responsiv design och kompatibilitet mellan olika webbläsare
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och förbättra mobilapplikationer (iOS) i React Native
* Gedigen förståelse för RESTful API:er och erfarenhet av att integrera front-end-system med back-end-tjänster
* Vana av arbete i versionshanteringssystem (t.ex. Git) och CI/CD-pipelines
* Erfarenhet av Docker
* Förmåga att anpassa dig till förändrade prioriteringar och ändra uppgiftsfokus i linje med uppkomna behov
* Vilja att lära sig nya teknologier och arbeta med olika teknikstackar
* Ha ett väl utvecklat säkerhetstänk
* God svenska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Node.js
* Kännedom om Kubernetes och Helm
* Erfarenhet av GitHub Actions
* Kunskap om PostgreSQL och MongoDB
* Erfarenhet av .Net
* Erfarenhet av testning och dokumentation
* Erfarenhet av beställarkontakt och kravinsamling


 Ansökan
   

  

 SRS välkomnar mångfald! Olikheter skapar möjligheter och nytänkande som tillför nya perspektiv och idéer och hjälper oss att leverera bättre lösningar, produkter och råd till våra kunder och samarbetspartners.
   

  

 Att jobba för SRS innebär att du står för en hög etisk värdegrund, både på jobbet och privat. Genom att söka den här tjänsten försäkrar du att du delar våra värderingar samt att du tidigare inte har brutit mot mänskliga rättigheter.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan där du bifogar CV och personligt brev. Vi kommer behandla ansökningar löpande. Vi kommer att genomföra arbetspsykologiska tester samt bakgrundskontroller som del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 30 april 2025

title: React Native Developer
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for a React Native Developer to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a React Native Developer at Qred, you’ll be part of the team working with applications for existing customers together with other mobile app developers, frontend web developers, UX designers and a Product Manager. With your focus on React Native, you will play an important part in building and improving our mobile app to handle more features, customers and markets. The team is expected to take full ownership of how our products are presented and working, which means you’ll be part of planning, implementing, reviewing, testing and releasing software continuously as well as monitoring that it’s working as intended.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate within a team: Work closely with everyone in your team to find the best solutions and ensure we meet our goals.
* Ensure quality: Take responsibility for the quality of your work by creating and running tests as well as review the work of others to ensure the team produces good quality software.
* Drive innovation: With a DevOps mindset, improve our workflows and contribute to the optimization of operations and delivery.
* Promote security and performance: Ensure our systems are secure and perform at their best, even as our user base grows.


**Requirements**
* Mobile app development skills: Proven knowledge and at least 5 years of experience in writing, releasing and maintaining mobile applications.
* Architecture responsibility: Previous responsibility for maintaining platform architecture for mobile apps.
* Quality focus: You are comfortable writing and executing tests for your own code as well as reviewing code to ensure that the entire team produces good software.
* Communication and collaboration: You like working within a team, enjoy sharing knowledge and contribute to building a strong team spirit.
* Language skills: You are comfortable using English as your working language and understand the importance of clear communication in an international team.


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans, factoring and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fuelled by international expansion.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
 



  





 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As a Senior Software Engineer for Web Solutions, you will bring deep technical knowledge and experience into a team of software, test automation and quality assurance engineers. You will routinely collaborate with your peers booth within your own and other software teams to ensure adherence to common software development standards and practices. In this role, you will:
 


* Apply yourself to and drive software development efforts in our web-based solutions, in close collaboration with peers and team members.
* Take initiatives in how to best maintain any existing web-based products
* Take initiatives in building our new generation of web-based solutions
* Build a common understanding within the development team with regards to design patterns, software solution structures, dependencies and interfaces to other systems
* Take a leading role in the team’s planning and prioritization together with stakeholders
* Ensure software meets all requirements of quality, security, maintainability, extensibility etc



  





**What We're Looking For:** 



* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience with web-based and .NET-based backend systems.
* Proven ability to build, deliver, and maintain new and existing web solutions.
* Full-stack expertise, particularly in .NET and web development.
* Experience in designing and deploying full-stack web solutions, including installed applications.
* Familiarity with deployment platforms for web solutions and cloud-based operations (preferably Microsoft Azure).
* Strong knowledge of databases and modeling techniques.
* Understanding of software quality assurance principles.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* **Purpose-Driven Work:** 
 Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* **“Yes, and...” Flexibility:** 
 Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* **Growth and Development:** 
 Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* **Inclusive and Supportive Culture:** 
 Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* **A Global Leader with Heart:** 
 Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a

title: Back End Developer
description:
We are looking for developers who are passionate believers in microservice principles and wants to build a truly digital organization. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our microservice infrastructure, with a focus on enabling tailored solutions and integrations as required by our business. You will work closely with domain experts to understand their ways of working and build solutions that meet those needs. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining our DevSecOps procedures and governance policies.
 



  





**Key responsibilities (not limited to)** 



* Design, develop and operate backend services that are central to company's success, ensuring that our services are fast, scalable, and reliable
* Build and maintain infrastructure, tools and deployment pipelines.
* Take responsibility for the digital capabilities your team owns.
* Continuously improve our products through innovation and collaboration with other development and product teams.



  





**Requirements** 




 Competences and skills
 


* An academic degree in computer science, data science, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience building and maintaining backend services using Java, Kotlin or similar languages (mid-senior level).
* Awareness of engineering best practices such as continuous delivery and automated testing.
* Have exposure to tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, or event-driven architectures—though a willingness to learn is just as important.
* Ability to gather and translate business requirements into effective solutions and manage stakeholder relationships.



  





**Personal qualities** 



* Enthusiasm
* Problem-solving skills
* A genuine interest in aligning their work with our mission and values
* Communicate effectively across diverse domains and expertise levels
* Thrive in agile environments
* Have a growth mindset with enthusiasm for learning and trying new approaches

title: Dotnet Developer
description:
I have a new role for an experienced Solution Architect to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.
 



  





 There are based both in Stockholm this is a Hybrid position.

title: Java Software Engineer

 av agilt, teambaserat arbete

 av Java 17 eller 21

title: Backend developer, Java
description:
*Do you want to work in a culture where innovation, collaboration, and development are at the center? At Tre, you’ll be part of an engaged team where your technical skills make a real difference – both for our customers and for society.*
 IT Customer Management is part of the IT Development organization and consists of 31 employees and consultants. Right now, we’re taking over responsibility for developing and integrating with our Customer Contact systems. This is an exciting phase where we are establishing new architecture and working methods to create future-proof and efficient solutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a backend developer in Java, you will be key in integrating backend functionality with our Contact Center platforms, Genesys Cloud, Zendesk and Boost.ai. You will enhance existing applications while also building new solutions from scratch. Your work spans the entire development process from analysis to implementation, in close collaboration with IT architects, developers, and customer service stakeholders. While primarily focused on backend development, you may occasionally support frontend tasks. Balancing technical details with a broader perspective, you will ensure our solutions are modern, efficient and aligned with the business needs of our customer service organization and systems.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
 We are modernizing our systems and work with Java, Spring Boot, Openshift, TypeScript/JavaScript, Next.js, and React.
   

  

**You will look forward to**
* Being a key part of the architectural journey for the Customer Contact systems and taking technical responsibility for our integration implementations
* Working at a company that delivers critical infrastructure where your contribution directly contributes to societal benefits
* Being part of one of Sweden’s best workplaces according to Great Place To Work
* Belonging to an employer that strives to contribute to women choosing and staying in the tech industry; we are proud partners of Women in Tech and Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**A Bit More About You**
 We are looking for a curious and collaborative person who enjoys taking responsibility and contributing to a supportive team environment. You have experience in backend development with Java and feel comfortable working with complex systems. If you also have some knowledge of React, JavaScript and/or TypeScript, that’s great, as it allows you to contribute more broadly when needed. Since you will work closely with different teams, good communication skills are valuable, and you should feel comfortable discussing technical solutions in both English and Swedish.
   

  

 Having experience with technical migrations is an advantage, and if you are familiar with Genesys Cloud or Zendesk, that is another very good bonus—but not a requirement. AI knowledge and chatbot experience are further advantages.
   

  

 Most importantly, you are eager to learn, grow, and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and diversity.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 We are accepting applications via this job ad, and interviews are ongoing. A personal letter is not required, but we would like you to answer the questions we ask in connection with your application. We use tests to ensure objective assessments in the selection of candidates. The position may be filled before the application deadline. Background checks are carried out on the final candidate. We refrain from consulting requests.

title: Frontend Platform Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a day.
   

  

**This is you**
 To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our frontend technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.
   

  

**As a Frontend Platform Engineer, You**
* Find developer experience important and like to contribute to it
* Work with modern JavaScript (ES6+), CSS, HTML, TypeScript, NextJS, ReactJS, NodeJS, Jest/Vitest
* Have experience of or interested in learning GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes, ArgoCD, GitHub actions & Terraform
* Gets motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Like to be part of setting the architecture for the future
* Love to automate things


**Nordnetters**
* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure


**What We Offer**
* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working. Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: IoT Developer
company_industry: Embedded Software Products, Manufacturing, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Job Summary:** 
 IoT Developer
   

  

**Company:** 
 IPercept
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Starting with internship, with potential to turn into full-time employment
   

  

 IPercept is looking for a full-time IoT Developer who is passionate about Industrial IoT (IIoT), automation, and system reliability. This role provides hands-on experience in optimizing industrial monitoring systems' performance, reliability, and scalability while collaborating with skilled engineers on innovative projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Software Development: Design, develop, and deploy robust IoT applications.
* Device Management & Automation: Implement automation for efficient monitoring and maintenance of IIoT devices.
* Reliability & Testing: Optimize system performance through unit and integration testing.
* Monitoring & Logging: Configure monitoring systems, logging, and real-time alerting.
* Database Management: Develop and maintain structured databases for device tracking and manufacturing data.


**Skills & Qualifications**
* Solid understanding of Linux administration (comfortable with command-line tools, system configuration, troubleshooting, and automation).
* Scripting & Automation (Python, Bash for process automation and infrastructure management).
* Networking Knowledge (understanding of IP networking, firewalls, VPNs, and troubleshooting).
* Familiarity with database structures and management for IoT applications.
* Experience with self-hosted environments, cloud infrastructure, or edge computing is a plus.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Docker Compose, Kubernetes) and virtualization technologies is beneficial.


**What’s Offered**
* A dynamic, technology-driven work environment.
* Hands-on experience with advanced IIoT technologies.
* Collaboration with industry professionals.
* Career-enhancing technical and professional skill development.


**Application**
 Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

title: AI Developer
description:
Do you want to be part of a team that is developing tomorrow's businesses and
   

  

 organizations? At PwC Sweden, we share a common goal of contributing to something bigger than ourselves by building trust and transparency, making positive change, and creating long-term sustainable value. Together, we create a meaningful and rewarding career for you.
   

  

**Become a part of PwC’s Internal Firm Services**
 As an employee within PwC's business support, you play an important role in ensuring that the organization operates smoothly and efficiently and delivers value to our clients and stakeholders. Within business support, there are six units that collaborate to support internal operations. We work with everything from communications, marketing, human resources, and IT to finance, procurement, risk management, and quality assurance. By coordinating and collaborating within these various departments, the organization can leverage our specialized knowledge to support and improve operations on a larger scale.
   

  

**Are you our new colleague in the fast growing AI team?**
 Are you passionate about AI and eager to make a tangible impact? We are looking for a developer who excels in collaboration and enjoys building strong relationships with colleagues to ideate and develop exciting AI solutions. You are naturally curious and adaptable, finding joy in solving complex problems. You take pride in your personal responsibility and are driven to achieve outstanding results.
   

  

 We offer opportunities for your continuous professional growth, supported by the
   

  

 collaborative environment within the work environment you're part of. A strong
   

  

 inclination to collaboration is essential, as you will often work in diverse environments and support different business units.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Would Include**
* Lead the deployment and continuous maintenance of machine learning models


 and AI solutions, ensuring high performance and effectiveness in solving
   

  

 business challenges.
   

  

* Assist in the design and development of machine learning models and AI


 solutions to address business problems.
   

  

* Assist in the development and maintenance of product pipelines.
* Stay current with the latest advancements and industry trends in AI, and apply


 them to improve existing processes.
   

  

* Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance skills and knowledge,


 fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
   

  

**Qualifications For The Position**
* Relevant education, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science,


 Mathematics, Electronics or a related field.
   

  

* Proficiency in Python.
* Practical understanding of generative AI frameworks (vector databases,


 LangChain frameworks, OpenAI frameworks,etc).
   

  

* Experience working with technical requirements, development, testing, etc.
* Experience implementing machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g.,


 scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
   

  

* Excellent communication, presentation and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work effectively and adapt to diverse and dynamic environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in both spoken and written English.
* Collaborate with the global PwC network to identify opportunities for AI


 innovations and drive the implementation of new technologies and
   

  

 methodologies to PwC Sweden.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV
* Cover letter


 We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection. The tests are the first step in our selection process. You will receive a link to these tests after we have received your application.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.
   

  

**Do you have questions? Let us know!**
 Questions relating to the job will be answered by Nithin Virinchipuram,
   

  

 nithin.virinchipuram@pwc.com
   

  

 If you instead have questions about the recruitment process or your application, reach out to the recruiter: Michaela Lindgren at Michaela.lindgren@pwc.com

title: Fullstack Backend Engineer - Platform Insights
description:
We are looking for a mid-level Fullstack Engineer to join Platform Insights, part of Spotify’s Platform Developer Experience (PDX) team. We make Spotify engineers faster and more effective by driving improvements in developer flows across disciplines and provide tools to align on engineering standards and practices. You will be working in a small, nimble team tasked with speeding up our developer experience endeavors. You will dive deep into the GenAI space by both exploring applicability of existing GenAI products as well as building internal GenAI tools and measuring the impact these have in developer productivity.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work across the full stack (backend, frontend, data) with an emphasis on backend, to bring developer experience improvements to life.
* Design, develop, and maintain a variety of tools, systems, and resources—such as Backstage plugins, datasets, and libraries—that enhance the developer experience and our understanding of it.
* Conduct exploratory work and evaluate applicability and usefulness of introducing third-party tools (most notably Generative AI solutions) into our development workflows.
* Work with engineers in other teams within the product area to implement productivity improvements in existing systems.
* Maintain and evolve datasets that are powering our developer experience metrics.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are proficient in Java, confident with Typescript/Javascript, and knowledgable with Python
* You have a solid backend foundation and you feel comfortable working across the tech stack, with a keen interest to develop your skills in new domains.
* You have experience and knowledge from a broad set of technologies and practices, such as experimentation, UX/frontend, API design and implementation, or cloud stacks such as GCP.
* You have experience with the usage of GenAI for building internal tools and/or user-facing applications.
* Experience working in the developer experience space, and a familiarity with productivity frameworks and metrics would be a bonus.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm (Sweden) or London (UK)
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: AI Business Developer
description:
**Are you ready to bring the next generation of character animation tools to the world's leading game studios?** 




  





**Are you passionate about driving enterprise-level sales in the cutting-edge field of Generative AI?** 




  





**This is your opportunity.** 




  





 At Motorica, we believe that words articulate thought, but motion expresses the soul.
 



 Motorica is a fast-moving startup at the forefront and intersection of Generative AI and entertainment, working with some of the biggest studios in the world.
 



  





**About Motorica:** 




 The team at Motorica is putting the power to animate into everyone's hands.
 



 Our platform—already recognized as a research and product leader in the rapidly emerging motion modality, one of the six fundamental generative AI modalities alongside image, video, audio, text, and geometry—empowers game studios to create dynamic, lifelike animation faster and more affordably than ever before.
 



  





**What You'll Do as an AI Business Developer:** 




 The ideal candidate will possess exceptional enterprise sales experience, strategic thinking, and the ability to navigate complex, high-value deals with multiple stakeholders.
 



  





**Drive Enterprise Growth:** 
 Lead strategic sales initiatives targeting AA+/AAA game studios and major entertainment companies, managing deals valued at $100K+ annually.
 



  





**C-Level Engagement:** 
 Build and maintain relationships with C-suite executives and key decision-makers within major gaming and entertainment organizations.
 



  





**Strategic Account Planning:** 
 Develop and execute comprehensive account strategies to expand Motorica's presence within enterprise accounts while maximizing revenue potential.
 



  





**Complex Deal Navigation:** 
 Orchestrate and close sophisticated, multi-stakeholder deals while coordinating cross-functional internal teams to support enterprise client needs.
 



  





**Enterprise Pipeline Management:** 
 Own and optimize the full enterprise sales cycle, from prospecting to closing, with a focus on large-scale, organization-wide implementations.
 



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 Proven Enterprise Sales Success: 5+ years of enterprise software sales experience, with a track record of closing deals $100K+ and managing long-term client relationships.
 



  





**Strategic Execution:** 
 Demonstrated ability to take lead on complex sales cycles and navigate multiple stakeholder relationships at the enterprise level.
 



  





**Executive Presence:** 
 Presentation and negotiation skills, with experience selling to C-level executives in large organizations.
 



  





**Technical Acumen:** 
 Understanding of enterprise software implementation and integration challenges, with the ability to articulate technical value propositions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



  





**This would make you a particularly good match:** 



* Gaming Industry Expertise: Deep understanding of AAA game studio operations, animation pipelines, and enterprise-level challenges in the gaming industry.
* MEDDIC Methodology Experience
* Games / Animation Industry Experience



  





**Compensation and benefits:** 



* Competitive Base Salary
* Uncapped Commission Structure
* Retirement Package
* Comprehensive Insurance Package
* Health Benefits (5000 SEK/year)
* Stock Options
* 6 weeks vacation



  





 Join us in transforming the future of animation technology at the enterprise level!

title: Software Engineer (Scala), Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.
   

  

 Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

 Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for an open minded and enthusiastic intermediate level Scala Engineer to join our backend team. We are a passionate and highly collaborative team with a a bias for qaulity and continuous improvement. If you are looking for an environment where you can learn and see your ideas come to life let's talk!
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET ( +/-2 hours).
   

  

**What You'll Be Responsible For**
* Design and write sustainable, easy to read and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed.
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries
* Review feedback on the specs and the code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Make recomendations regarding introducing new tools and improving processes.
* Continuous learning of different programming paradigms and new technologies
* Work with a highly collaborative group of engineers.


**What You'll Bring To Maropost**
* 3+years of experience in Scala.
* 2+years experience with mapping business domains into into SQL schemas.
* Experience with message based architectures (we use Pulsar).
* Knowledge in API design (REST or GraphQL).
* Understand and work with modern cloud native infrastructure (we deploy to Kubernetes).
* Responsible for builds and CI/CD processes (we use CircleCI for builds and GitOps with ArgoCD for back end deployments).
* Excellent communication skills, a bias for feedback and continuous improvement combined with the ability to work collaboratively in cross functional teams.
* The ability to take ownership annd initiatives over tasks/projects and share any new ideas witth the team.


**Equal Employment Opportunist**
 Maropost is deeply committed to promoting diversity, advancing equity and fostering a culture of inclusion. Therefore, we invite applications from marginalized and equity-seeking groups. Individuals seeking employment at Maropost are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please feel free to reach out to the recruitment team for any accommodation requests or questions.

title: CE Developer
description:
Next Ventures are seeking a skilled D365CE Developer to join an international organization on an initial 6 month contract with expertise in Sales and Marketing working with team members across borders in Europe.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Design and implement solutions in
 **Dynamics 365** 
 and
 **Azure** 
 that meet business requirements.
* Assist in planning, designing, and customizing Dynamics solutions, with a focus on the
 **Customer Insights module** 
 .
* Drive continuous improvements in the services delivered, ensuring the alignment of technical solutions with evolving business needs.
* Collaborate closely with business teams to ensure seamless integration of technical and functional requirements.
* Create and manage custom
 **APIs** 
 and
 **plugins** 
 in Dynamics 365.

 and the broader

 to enhance Dynamics 365 functionalities.



  





**Skills & Qualifications:** 



* **At least 7 years** 
 of overall experience, with Microsoft Dynamics CRM or CE
* Hands-on experience in creating

 in Dynamics 365.

 **Power Platform CLI** 
 and the
 **Power Platform ecosystem** 
 .

 technologies, including cloud integration and services.
