title: Global Digital Designer
description:
Are you an experienced Digital Designer with a passion for the great outdoors and digital innovation? Fjällräven’s Marketing Department is looking for a Global Digital Designer to join our creative team for nine months to cover a parental leave. This is your opportunity to shape digital experiences while working with a brand committed to sustainability, functionality, and design excellence.

**About the Role**
  

As a Digital Designer, you will be responsible for driving Fjällräven’s creative digital vision, crafting visually engaging, user-focused experiences across multiple platforms. You will collaborate closely with teams across eCommerce, global marketing, UX/UI, and development to ensure that every digital asset aligns with our brand identity and engages our customers.


This role provides an exciting opportunity to contribute to digital marketing campaigns and content creation while managing the tools and systems that enhance Fjällräven’s digital presence and impact.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with the Global Visual Design team, Copywriters, and Creative Leads to develop innovative and engaging content for campaigns and digital marketing across multiple channels.
* Act as the primary contact for eCommerce design, optimizing digital assets such as landing pages, ads, and email marketing to align with our values and customer needs.
* Oversee the Marigold Engage system and drive UX/UI improvements.
* Manage digital design tools such as Figma and Optimizely, as well as other relevant platforms like Sanity, working closely with teams to streamline design processes.
* Work with internal teams (designers, copywriters, eCommerce) to align digital strategies with business goals while ensuring technical consistency with platform requirements.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies such as AR, VR, and AI to enhance user experiences and strengthen the brand’s digital presence.

**Who You Are**


As a Global Digital Designer, you are a proactive, self-motivated creative professional who thrives in dynamic environments. You have a deep understanding of visual design and are comfortable working across both the creative and technical aspects of digital design. Your ability to lead cross-functional initiatives across multiple channels and manage multiple projects will be key to your success.


**Qualifications & Skills**:


* Bachelor’s degree in Visual Design, Interactive Design, or a related field.
* 5–7 years of experience as a Digital Designer in an agency or in-house role.
* Strong expertise in creating engaging digital content across web, email, and social media.
* Proficiency in digital design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, XD), Sketch, InVision, and Figma.
* Experience in photo and video editing, with an understanding of best practices in digital content creation.
* A strong portfolio showcasing digital design work across multiple platforms.
* Excellent communication skills in English; additional languages are a plus.

**Personal Attributes:**

* You are confident in taking ownership of projects while fostering collaboration across teams.
* You approach challenges with creativity and an innovative mindset, always seeking solutions that benefit both the brand and the customer.
* You simplify complex ideas and communicate them effectively to a variety of stakeholders.
* You bring positive energy to team environments, contributing to shared goals with enthusiasm.
* You stay organized and manage multiple projects effectively, even in high-pressure situations.
* You have a keen eye for detail while maintaining a strategic perspective in your design decisions.


This position is based at our office in Solna.


If you are a talented Digital Designer with a strong creative vision, we encourage you to apply through our career page in English. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: UX Designer - Platform
description:
We are looking for a passionate UX Designer to join Spotify’s Digital Asset Management team in Stockholm. The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, driving rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many subject areas, we work to make the business work, creating the frameworks, capabilities, and tools needed to welcome a billion customers.
   

  

 The Digital Asset Management PA sits in the Design Platform Studio The team’s mission is to connect and optimize the digital supply chain for creative assets at Spotify, making it easy to store, find, create, and serve content at scale with a focus on usage rights compliance. It plays a critical role in connecting data to digital assets, using our digital asset management tool.
   

  

 If you’re an excellent designer and phenomenal collaborator with a strong interest in building scalable design systems and solutions, this opportunity might be your calling. Join us and help amplify productivity, quality, and innovation across Spotify.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design; this is a hands-on UX design role, you’ll take full ownership of design work from concept through execution.
* Formulate and apply design strategies that resonate with Spotify's aesthetic and functional standards.
* Engage in design prototyping and adopt an iterative approach through active user feedback and usability testing.
* Partner with engineers, designers, and product teams to translate user needs into technical requirements and deliver impactful design solutions.
* Collaborate with partners to identify challenges, capture feedback, and continuously improve the platform’s value and usability.
* Build a deep understanding of upstream and downstream workflows to ensure the solution integrates seamlessly with existing systems and processes.
* Enhance UX by refining interfaces for improved UI consistency across customer platforms.
* Collaborate; you’ll represent Editorial Design Platform while working with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world. You’ll partner closely with engineers, designers and project managers to create elegant and practical solutions
* Innovate; you’ll contribute to evolving one of the world’s most iconic brands, respecting our past while looking toward our future.
* Lead; you’ll be a leader in your own work, take charge to drive your projects forward, and inspire your peers to do their best work.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have 3+ years of UX design experience, with a consistent record of successfully working on scalable as well as elegant design solutions.
* You have experience working on workflow optimization, enterprise systems, or tools that support internal teams (experience with digital asset management systems is a plus).
* You are passionate about UX design and can communicate and discuss design flows as well as technical requirements
* You are passionate about building systems that empower teams and streamline complex workflows with ease and efficiency.
* You have great communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and non-technical audiences, such as engineers, designers, and product managers.
* You thrive in ambiguity and adapt quickly to evolving priorities, maintaining focus on delivering value to the business and users.
* You have experience working and collaborating in cross-functional teams to achieve shared objectives.
* You are a self-starter with a proactive working style who sees the opportunity for growth and learning in your day-to-day work.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location. \*Excluding France due to on-call restrictions.
* This team operates within the Central Eastern time zone for collaboration.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:
**Shape the Visual Future of Björk and Berries** 




  





 Björk and Berries is a Swedish fragrance and beauty brand rooted in 
 **nature, craftsmanship, and storytelling** 
 . Every design element we create is an extension of our brand’s philosophy—minimal yet expressive, modern yet timeless. We are looking for a 
 **Junior Graphic Designer** 
  to help bring our visual identity to life across multiple touchpoints while ensuring that every creative decision stays true to our brand essence.
 



  
 



 This is a unique opportunity to 
 **experiment, push creative boundaries, and introduce fresh ideas** 
 , but always in a way that reinforces our brand’s 
 **premium, thoughtful, and nature-inspired aesthetic** 
 . You will work on 
 **campaigns, packaging, product design, and social media** 
 , ensuring consistency while finding innovative ways to evolve our visual language.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 









**Brand & Campaign Design** 



* Develop visually compelling 
 **campaign and commercial assets** 
  across print, digital, and social platforms.
* Deeply understand the 
 **brand’s DNA, aesthetic, and vision** 
 , ensuring that every design reflects the essence of Björk and Berries.
* Balance 
 **creative exploration with brand consistency** 
 , introducing 
 **smart, thoughtful innovations** 
  without losing the core identity.
* Work closely with 
 **Marketing, Creative and Product Development** 
  to develop cohesive campaigns, product launches, and marketing materials that reinforce our brand story.







**Product & Packaging Design** 



* Assist in the 
 **conceptualization and development of product packaging** 
  and branding elements.
* Collaborate with the 
 **Product Manager (PM)** 
  to ensure designs are both 
 **aesthetically compelling, cost-efficient, and functional** 
 .
* Create 
 **detailed artworks, quick sketches, 3D models, and prototypes** 
  to bring design concepts to life.
* Refine designs based on feedback, ensuring that updates maintain the 
 **brand’s identity while evolving with market trends**



  





**Merchandise & POSM (Point of Sale Materials)** 



* Design 
 **merchandise and promotional materials** 
  that enhance brand presence in retail spaces.
* Ensure all 
 **point-of-sale materials (POSM)** 
  are visually striking while remaining true to Björk and Berries’ core aesthetic.



  





**Digital & Social Media Content** 



* Create 
 **engaging, on-brand digital content** 
  for social media, partners, website, and e-commerce platforms.
* Experiment with fresh 
 **visual storytelling techniques** 
 , while keeping the brand’s visual language and premium feel intact.
 **Market Research & Trend Analysis**
* Stay updated on 
 **industry trends, competitors, and emerging design techniques** 
  to maintain a competitive edge.
* Integrate 
 **customer insights and feedback** 
  into the design process to refine and enhance creative output.
 **Material & Sustainability Focus**
* Keep up to date with 
 **new materials and packaging innovations** 
  that enhance product aesthetics while aligning with sustainability goals.
* Design for 
 **efficient production methods** 
 , prioritizing materials with minimal environmental impact, including reduced greenhouse gas emissions and packaging waste.



  





**Who You Are:** 



* A creative and strategic thinker with a strong 
 **understanding of branding, visual storytelling, and design psychology** 
 .
* Highly proficient in 
 **Adobe Creative Suite** 
  (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign); experience with 
 **3D modeling, motion graphics, or prototyping software** 
  is a plus.
* A 
 **perceptive and adaptable designer** 
 , able to push creative boundaries while maintaining a strong connection to the brand identity.
* A team player who thrives in a 
 **fast-paced, collaborative environment** 
  and can manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Previous experience or internships in 
 **beauty, fashion, lifestyle, or luxury branding** 
  is an advantage.
* A minimum of 2 years of work experience in the similar position.







**What We Offer:** 



* A 
 **creative and dynamic work environment** 
 , where design is a core driver of brand growth.
* The opportunity to work on 
 **a wide range of projects** 
 , from campaign visuals to packaging and product design.
* A growing company with a 
 **strong brand identity, ambitious goals, and a commitment to craftsmanship and innovation** 
 .
* A workplace that values 
 **creativity, intelligent design, and sustainability** 
 .



  





  





 Send your application and portfolio to career@bjorkandberries.com
 **latest April 13th.** 




  





 We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and may fill the position before the application deadline if we find the right candidate.

title: Product Owner
job_function: Product Management, Information Technology, and Quality Assurance
description:
**The Company:** 




  





 Our client is a fast-growing, global B2C iGaming operator. They are well-funded by a major US investor and have an accomplished senior leadership from major Tier 1 operators running the venture. They’re expanding their products, brands and new markets heavily and are looking for a talented Product Owner (or Senior Product Owner - dependent on experience) to join their growing team in Stockholm!
 



  





**Job profile:** 




  





 • Manage the Roadmap: Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize features and initiatives, balancing long-term vision with immediate business value.
 



 • Drive UX Excellence: Work closely with UX designers to ensure that every user touchpoint is intuitive, impactful, and simple.
 



 • Collaboration: Act as the bridge between business stakeholders, tech teams, and other departments, ensuring clear communication and alignment.
 



 • Analytics-Driven: Use data to inform decisions, track product performance, and identify opportunities for optimization and growth.
 



 • Lead Agile Development: Own the backlog, write clear user stories, and ensure smooth planning with the tech team.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




  





 • Minimum 4 years of experience as a Product Owner or a similar role in tech-driven environments, with a proven track record of delivering impactful digital solutions with a detail-oriented mindset.
 



 • Experience with Jira and Agile methodologies is a must
 



 • Expertise in developing and optimizing mobile apps and web platforms.
 



 • Strong understanding of UX design principles and experience working closely with design teams. A huge bonus is if you are familiar with tools like Figma and can create simple wireframes.
 



 • Excellent at managing diverse stakeholders and navigating organizational needs.
 



 • Solid knowledge of roadmap planning, prioritization, and backlog management.
 



 • Analytical mindset – you’re comfortable with data tools and know how to use insights to drive decisions
 



 • A natural communicator, both verbally and in writing, with the ability to inspire and align diverse audiences
 



 • Bonus: Experience in the igaming industry, link to your github profile

title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
**Join Us on a Journey of Growth – Shaping Impactful Customer Journeys as a CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist** 




  





**About Us** 




 At Souk Agency, growth is about building meaningful and long-term connections and partnerships. We combine creativity, data, and technology to help brands grow in impactful ways. As we expand, we’re looking for a
 **CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist** 
 who shares our passion for innovation and customer success.
 



 In this role, you won’t just be part of the team; you’ll help shape it. Your contributions will drive both our clients’ growth and our internal strategies, leading to long-term, transformative results. If you’re ready to take initiative, collaborate with a forward-thinking team, and help us create lasting impact, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**Job description** 




 We are looking for a passionate and motivated individual to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to make a real impact on customer success by driving engagement and improving retention through the strategic use of CRM and Marketing Automation. You'll be hands-on in executing campaigns, building automated customer journeys, and creating targeted segments within our CRM and MA systems. You'll play a key role in working directly with clients and enhancing our internal processes to help optimize customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Work closely with clients to understand their business objectives and create personalized, automated customer journeys and workflows that align with both client needs and business goals.
* Oversee the ongoing management of CRM and MA platforms, ensuring data accuracy, organization, and effective segmentation for better customer targeting and engagement.
* Partner with internal teams such as Performance Marketing, UX/CX, and Data Analytics to enhance campaign performance and improve customer experiences.
* Analyze campaign performance, monitor key metrics, and provide actionable insights to optimize campaigns, drive innovation, and increase ROI.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in CRM and Marketing Automation, continuously bringing fresh ideas and innovative solutions to enhance client experiences and optimize internal processes



  





**What You Bring to the Team:** 




  




* 3+ years of experience in CRM and Marketing Automation within a digital marketing environment.
* Hands-on experience with CRM and MA platforms such as HubSpot, Salesforce, Pipedrive, Klaviyo, Braze, Customer.io, or similar.
* Strong understanding of customer segmentation, lifecycle marketing, and omnichannel engagement.
* Proficiency in CDPs and data analysis/reporting tools such as GA4, Amplitude, Segment, Mixpanel, or Looker.
* Experience in A/B testing and performance optimization.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong communication skills and a data-driven mindset.



  





**Not essential, but an advantage if you have:** 




  




* Knowledge of SQL or basic coding for automation enhancements.
* Familiarity with API integrations and CRM/MA platform customizations.
* Previous agency experience.



  





**What You Can Expect From Us:** 




  





 We’re a team that values being authentic, learning, and collaborating. Every project is an opportunity to grow, create, and and see how far we can go. We’re all about taking on new challenges and getting better with every step.
 



  




* A dynamic, supportive and collaborative work environment.
* Flexible work arrangements and competitive compensation.
* Office located at Östermalm, Stockholm.
* Training and certifications.
* Laptop of choice.



  





 At Souk we believe in a work environment where diverse perspectives and experiences strengthen our collective success. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the qualifications – many underestimate their own abilities, and if you feel you have something to contribute, don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 Please note that we are continuously interviewing candidates and may close the ad earlier.
 



 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process please contact
 
 lowisa@soukagency.com
 
 .

title: Scrum Master
description:
Är du resultat- och kvalitetsinriktad och är intresserad av teamutveckling? Drivs du av att utmana och förbättra arbetssätt, och av att få människor att växa? Trivs du när du får använda din problemlösningsförmåga till att underlätta för teamet att nå sina mål och leveranser?
   

  

 Vi söker engagerade Scrum Masters till vår it-avdelning. Hos oss levererar du och ditt team lösningar som förenklar för företag och privatpersoner. Du får möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som Scrum Master ansvarar du för att underlätta för teamet att nå tågets mål och leveranser genom att vägleda teamet i överenskomna principer och coacha dem till ett effektivt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du etablerar goda samarbetsformer med RTE och övriga Scrum Masters i tåget. Du förbereder och leder planeringar och jobbar aktivt med att underlätta kommunikation, koordination, samordning och samarbete i teamet, mellan utvecklingsteam och med verksamheten. Du har ansvar för teamets kontinuerliga utveckling och kunskapsspridning. Tillsammans skapar du och teamet en kultur som engagerar och framkallar det bästa ur varje medarbetare.
   

  

 Du arbetar i ett agilt team där ni tillsammans ansvarar för både utveckling och förvaltning. I teamet reflekterar ni tillsammans och kommer med förslag på förbättringar och lösningar samt hjälper varandra på ett prestigelöst sätt. Problemlösning och nytänkande är en viktig del av teamets arbete och kännetecknas av förbättrande, respekt, ärlighet och öppenhet.
   

  

 Teamet är tvärfunktionellt, och teamen använder sin bredd och sitt djup genom att lära av varandra inom teamet.
   

  

 Vårt utvecklingsarbete sker med stöd av ramverket SAFe. Ditt team ingår i ett agilt utvecklingståg där all utveckling för de ingående teamen samplaneras över ett antal iterationer. Arbetet leds av en Release Train Engineer (RTE)
   

  

 Vi arbetar enligt principen ”you build it you run it” vilket innebär att teamet har ansvar för både nyutveckling, vidareutveckling och förvaltning av system.
   

  

 Du har frihet och eget ansvar att bidra till nya lösningar. Vi är en stor IT-avdelning som erbjuder dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Din placeringsort är Göteborg, Visby eller Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara en lyhörd samarbetsvillig person som har förmåga att skapa engagemang
* vara resultatinriktad och ta egna initiativ
* ha ett strukturerat och metodiskt arbetssätt
* ha god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska, både i tal och skrift
* ha förmåga att vara förutsättningsskapande för flera än sig själv


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* ha flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta som Scrum Master
* aktuell erfarenhet av att coacha team och viktiga intressenter till ett agilt arbetssätt


 Det är också önskvärt att du har en relevant eftergymnasial it-utbildning och/eller mångårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling. Vidare är det önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av arbete inom en eller flera andra systemutvecklingsdiscipliner så som kravanalys, UX, utveckling (i Java eller .Net) eller test.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 4 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Göteborg, Sundbyberg, Visby | Län: Ospecificerad arbetsort | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/168 | Kontakt: Annika van't Hoff, sektionschef annika.vant.hoff@skatteverket.se, Frida Hörnquist, hr-specialist frida.hornquist@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-02-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-17

title: Junior SEO Specialist
description:
Vi letar efter en nyfiken och driven teamspelare i form av en junior SEO-specialist till vårt talangfulla SEO team i Stockholm. Här blir du en del av en glad och social arbetsplats med utrymme för en avslappnad företagskultur med härliga AWs och gemenskap. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med några av branschens mest skickliga konsulter och välkända kunder, både i Sverige och globalt.
 



  





**Vilka är vi?** 




 TransAct är en växande performance-byrå inom Sveriges största mediekoncern, Omnicom Media Group. Vi är snart 40 medarbetare i Sverige och befinner oss i en expansiv tillväxtfas där vi letar efter ambitiösa och nyfikna personer som vill vara med att bygga vårt bolag. På TransAct jobbar vi med uppdrag inom SEO, SEM, CRO, Web analytics och UX. Vi har ett nära samarbete med våra systerbyråer OMD, PHD, Hearts & Science, Annalect, Transact & Drum som tillsammans består av 270+ fantastiska medarbete på den svenska marknaden. Vi jobbar tätt med våra nordiska kollegor och tillsammans håller vi nu på att bygga Nordens främsta performance-byrå!
 



  





**Vad du kommer att göra** 




 Som junior SEO-specialist på TransAct kommer du att arbeta med SEO för våra kunder inom olika branscher, tillsammans med en mer senior kollega.
 



  





 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som faller inom rollen:
 


* Skapa och utveckla SEO strategier
* Utföra olika SEO-analyser, så som sökordsanalys, teknisk analys
* Samarbete och kravställning mot webbutvecklare och produktionsteam
* SEO-rekommendationer så som innehållsrekommendationer, tekniska rekommendationer



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi tror att du är en omtänksam person som trivs att arbeta både självständigt som i team. Vi tror att du tycker om att lära dig nya saker och dela med dig av din kunskap, samt har ett stort intresse för SEO. Vi önskar att du checkar av följande punkter:
 


* Intresse för SEO och digital marknadsföring, kanske har du tidigare byggt egna siter?
* Goda kunskaper i Excel och/eller Google Sheets
* Du behärskar det svenska och engelska språket mycket väl, såväl muntligt men framför allt skriftligt.



  





**Det är en bonus om du har** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet av SEO
* Kunskaper i CMS
* Säljerfarenhet och kunddialog



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 



* Utveckling inom SEO och andra digitala kanaler tillsammans med några av Sveriges- och världens största kunder.
* Ett fyrverkeri av afterworks, konferensresor, event och roliga aktiviteter som gör att vi hittar varandra både som kollegor och vänner.
* Kylskåp med drycker efter önskemål, PS5, sällskapsspel och andra roligheter.
* Attraktiva förmåner som tjänstepension och försäkringar, friskvårdsbidrag med tillgång till förmånsportalen Benify
* Tillgång till seniora kollegor både i Sverige, Norden och globalt
* 37,5 timmars arbetsvecka med flexibelt kontorsarbete



  





 Vi hoppas att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa och ser fram emot att lära känna dig bättre. Ansök enkelt på 30 sekunder med din Linkedinprofil eller CV! Vi intervjuar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista svarsdatum. För frågor om tjänsten, varmt välkommen att kontakta Organic Search Director – Therese Hamberg på therese.hamberg@omctransact.com

title: GO Beyond - Early Careers Program Sweden
description:
**GO Beyond Program – Early Career Rotational Experience (Sweden)**
**📍 Locations: Sweden**
**📅 Start Date: Q3 2025**
**🕒 Application Deadline: 6th April, 2025**
**Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**
 You've got ambition. You've made an impact in your first role. Now, you're looking for the next challenge – something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.
   

  

 Welcome to GO Beyond – Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with 1-3 years of professional experience.
   

  

**What will I be doing at Ericsson?**
* You’ll join a team working on real business challenges and reshaping Ericsson's operations.
* You might help develop Gen AI strategies for adopting new technology or support projects modernizing our systems and processes.
* You won't just watch transformation happen – you’ll be part of making it happen. Our leadership team discusses digital initiatives and automation in company meetings, and you'll be contributing to those projects.
* In your first few months, you'll build relationships across departments while engaging with meaningful work. As you progress, you'll participate in workshops with business teams, contribute to project plans, and see how your work connects to Ericsson’s bigger picture. And that's just your first rotation!


**What is GO Beyond?**
* A permanent early career program with two six-month rotations across different GFGO units.
* Meaningful projects that contribute to Ericsson's transformation.
* Personal development through coaching, mentoring, and leadership exposure.
* Global teamwork with colleagues across Sweden, India, and worldwide.


**Your GO Beyond Journey**
* First 6 months: Learn about Ericsson’s business, meet key team members, and start contributing to transformation projects in your primary role.
* Second rotation: Rotate to a different department to broaden your experience and gain new skills.
* Post-rotation: Return to your permanent role, take on high-impact projects, and continue your development with new responsibilities.


**Roles and Key Focus Areas**
 The GO Beyond program has nine roles available across three key areas. For more in-depth information, check out the GO Beyond careers program.
   

  

* Strategic Growth and Transformation – 5 Roles


 This area focuses on driving business strategy, organizational change, and high-impact transformation across the business.
   

  

* Units: EIT M&A, EIT Employee Experience, Group Strategy, EIT Enablement, Group Sourcing
* Key Focus: Business strategy, AI-driven business models, transformation leadership, change management in sourcing and employee experience.
* Core Skills: Project management, IT system integration, M&A processes (EIT M&A)
* UX design, employee engagement, digital tools adoption (EIT Employee Experience)
* Strategic analysis, operational transformation, AI-driven business models (Group Strategy)
* Sourcing transformation, change management, AI & automation (Group Sourcing)
* Change leadership, platform adoption, digital transformation (EIT Enablement)
* Looking for: Self-starters with strong interests in driving transformation initiatives, managing change, and leading strategic projects.
* Data-Driven Operations and Transformation – 3 Roles


 This area uses data to improve performance, optimise processes, and ensure compliance.
   

  

* Units: Group Sourcing, EIT Business Empowerment, EIT Core Operations,
* Key Focus: Data governance, compliance, procurement systems optimisation, service integration, performance management
* Core Skills: o Data analysis, digital transformation, automation tools, AI (Group Sourcing, EIT Business Empowerment) AND Service integration, IT systems, enterprise IT (EIT Core Operations)
* Looking for Self-driven individuals who can work independently, use data to optimise operations, and solve complex problems in a data-driven environment.
* Digital Transformation and Technology Integration – 1 Role


 This area focuses on integrating emerging technologies, such as AI and automation, to drive business transformation and innovation.
   

  

* Unit: Group Digital Transformation
* Key Focus: Digital transformation, AI & automation integration, technology solutions for procurement and cloud-based systems
* Core Skills: Digital transformation, AI, machine learning, and cloud solutions
* We are looking for people with initiative who can adopt and implement technology solutions and drive operational efficiency through digital transformation.


**About GFGO**
 Group Function Global Operations (GFGO) was established in 2022 to streamline global operations, improve customer and employee experiences, and enhance agility and competitiveness. By consolidating various support functions, such as sourcing and Enterprise IT, and People and Finance functions, under one umbrella, GFGO helps drive operational efficiency across Ericsson.
   

  

**Why Choose GO Beyond?**
* Meaningful work: Contribute to Ericsson's future through key projects in technology and business improvement.
* Career growth: Develop your skills with exposure to senior leaders and strategic projects.
* Global experience: Work with teams across countries and cultures.
* Clear progression: Build the foundation for leadership roles.
* Ongoing development: Access training in new technologies and business practices.


 Check out - https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/student-young-professionals/early-career-rotation for more information.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 764350
   

  

 ]]>

title: Product Area Expert, Consumer Experience
description:
**About Us**
 For us going to work every day has an even greater purpose than putting the latest product or technology on the market. It’s about improving the everyday lives of millions. By staying humble and open to new ideas – we can push the boundaries for cooking, cleaning and well-being at home. But to keep doing so, we need more people who want to innovate and re-imagine what life at home can be.
   

  

 For that, we employ great people from a wide variety of backgrounds – not just because it’s the right thing to do, but also because we believe that diverse perspectives make our business stronger and more innovative. If you share our values, come find your place in our global community. Meet us at @lifeatelectrolux and career.electroluxgroup.com to learn more
   

  

**Join us to create** 
**consumer insights that will translate into consumer-centric decisions impacting Consumer Experience around the world.**
 At Electrolux Group, we place the consumer at the heart of everything. Today consumers are in the driver’s seat, so it is crucial to understand their journeys with us to adapt. The
 **Consumer Direct Interaction - Experience Organization (CDI XO)** 
 team is looking for
 **a Product Area Expert, Consumer Experience.**
**All about the role:**
 As our CX Product Area Expert you will help us to optimize the Customer Experience program with the goal to maximize actionability of the insights and democratize the data. You will make relevant insights available, find different hypotheses, and support with root cause analysis.
   

  

 You will be responsible for dedicated scope from the agreed roadmap to business release and lifecycle management of your own expertise within the CX area. You will contribute to the product area roadmap that outlines the planned improvements or new feature development.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Leverage deep knowledge of Consumer Experience management to provide product expertise and guidance to maximize the value of existing features and capabilities.
* Lead initiatives related to Consumer Experience, visualize and democratize consumer insight for a broad internal audience.
* Analysis of our performance toward end consumers, identifying incremental opportunities for enhancement, and translating them into inputs for business KPI improvement.
* Regular communication and translation of data-driven insight results into actions, aligning with our overall strategy and goals.
* Coordinate external agencies and collaborate with different cross-functional teams to optimize the Consumer journey and continually measure its performances to maximize sales and minimize cost of serve.
* Participate in all stages of the digital product development cycle: support the team with relevant analysis, take part in concept development, and contribute to formulating requirements and suggesting improvements.


**Who you are:**
* You keep the consumer top of mind, bringing an outside-in perspective
* You are Data-driven and fluent in data analysis and customer research
* You are a good communicator and you can simplify complex ideas translating them into useful insights for a variety of audience groups


**Requirements:**
* Preferred 3+ years in Consumer Experience, Voice of Customer, loyalty, insight, research, marketing or similar
* Proven experience in Project management
* Strong understanding of customer surveys, analytics, and insight tools (we currently use Qualtrics)
* A good foundation of user-centered design principles, UX Design best practices, trends, and emerging technologies
* Strong expertise in requirement gathering, analysis, and prioritization within a product development context.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
* Demonstrated ability to take ownership, lead initiatives, and deliver results.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

**Benefits include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment;
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services;
* Family-friendly benefits such as extended paternity leave (4 weeks);
* Insurance policy plan;
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more** 
**on:** 
 www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Graphic Designer with a Scientific Edge
description:
BioLamina is looking for a Graphic Designer with a scientific edge to play a key role in visually communicating complex scientific concepts. Your designs will engage researchers and industry professionals worldwide, strengthening our global presence and refining our brand identity across both digital and print formats.
   

  

 With a scientific background, you will have a deep understanding of our customers' needs, allowing you to create designs that are not only visually compelling but also clear and impactful. Brand consistency will be at the core of your work, ensuring a seamless experience across all customer touchpoints.
   

  

 Success in this role requires the ability to transform complex scientific data into captivating narratives. Your expertise in data-driven storytelling, through infographics and scientific imagery, will make intricate concepts accessible to a broad audience. Through close collaboration, you will contribute fresh ideas to brainstorming sessions and campaign development, bringing creativity and clarity to every project. Strong communication skills and a team-oriented mindset will be essential in this fast-paced, dynamic environment.
   

  

 This position offers an exciting opportunity to explore innovative presentation techniques, pushing the boundaries of scientific communication. The employment will be on a fixed-term contract for an initial duration of one year.
   

  

 BioLamina is a rapidly growing biotechnology company dedicated to advancing scientific innovation. Our pioneering cell culture solutions are trusted by researchers globally, particularly in stem cell and regenerative medicine. Your contributions will help establish BioLamina as a leader in this evolving industry.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and develop high-quality marketing assets for digital, print, and social media, including brochures, infographics, presentations, web visuals, and videos.
* Transform complex scientific concepts into clear, engaging, and impactful visuals.
* Present ideas and concepts with strong visual storytelling to internal and external stakeholders.
* Maintain brand consistency across all platforms and customer touchpoints.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with scientists, marketers, product teams, and external partners to convey key insights visually.
* Stay ahead of design trends, industry innovations, and new tools to enhance visual storytelling.
* Experiment with creative formats to present scientific content in engaging and accessible formats.
* Contribute to brainstorming and campaign planning with innovative design solutions.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Degree or Higher National Diploma in Graphic Design or a related field, with a strong portfolio.
* At least 3 years of experience as a Graphic Designer, preferably in Life Sciences, Healthcare, or a related industry.
* A scientific background (education or work experience in biotechnology, life sciences, or related disciplines).
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator) and Figma. Video editing and motion graphics abilities are desirable.
* A strong understanding of digital marketing and experience designing for various channels (social media, web, email, print).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* Experience in motion design (After Effects, Premiere Pro) is a plus.


**Personal Skills**
 We are seeking a creative and adaptable team player who thrives in a collaborative environment. You bring originality to your designs while ensuring brand consistency and can seamlessly balance creative direction with independent work. Strong time management and organizational skills enable you to handle multiple projects efficiently.
   

  

 In this fast-paced role, excellent written and verbal communications skills are essential, as you will collaborate across teams to create clear, engaging, and impactful visual messaging. Your ability to translate complex data into compelling infographics and scientific visuals will be key to effectively conveying our story.
   

  

**Biolamina**
 At BioLamina, you will be part of a global organization, working alongside dedicated, high-performing colleagues who share a passion for making a difference. We believe our products have the power to change the world, and we are driven by ambitious goals to achieve that vision. As a learning organization, we grow both from each other and from external insights.
   

  

 We value our employees and are committed to fostering a work environment that is not only pleasant and sustainable but also safe. We take pride in offering an inclusive and equal workspace where everyone has access to fair opportunities, equal pay, and is embraced for their unique qualities. Diversity and inclusion are integral to everything we do.
   

  

 BioLamina AB is a Swedish biotech company born from groundbreaking scientific research at Karolinska Institutet. Our main products are recombinant laminins—human proteins that help maintain and expand pluripotent stem cells and other primary cell types, enabling their differentiation into specialized cell types. BioLamina is revolutionizing cell culture, and our products are empowering researchers worldwide to develop cellular therapies and contribute to the exciting field of regenerative medicine. For further information, please visit: http://www.biolamina.com
   

  

 BioLamina in Sundbyberg is a Swedish biotech company serving clients within research, biotech, and pharma globally. BioLamina produces and develops premium laminins, which are proteins used in e.g., stem-cell research and cell therapy development. We are a growing team, working within production, R&D, quality, sales and marketing, and customer service. The company has a certified quality system according to ISO 9001:2015. We pride ourselves on being a sociable and inclusive workplace, and we are now searching for someone who will continue to embed our strong positive employee culture and values.

title: Head of Growth
description:
Henriksson is a self-storage company with a bold vision. As the demand for flexible, secure, and affordable storage solutions increases, we see a unique opportunity to fill the gap in the market. With fewer housing developments offering integrated storage solutions, our mission is to provide individuals and businesses with a cost-effective alternative. We are rapidly expanding across Europe. Founded by serial entrepreneurs, we offer a unique opportunity to be part in driving our strategic direction and growth.
 



  





 As Head of Growth at Henriksson, you will own the growth strategy and be responsible for the success in acquiring new customers and growing our customer base. You'll drive innovative marketing strategies to accelerate our customer acquisition and brand presence across Europe. We will rely on you to develop data-driven campaigns, optimize digital channels, and build robust customer funnels that deliver measurable results. A key part of the role involves owning and developing the Henriksson brand and enhancing the user experience on our website and apps, ensuring they align with our brand vision.
 



  





***Responsibilities include:***



* Creating and maintaining robust customer acquisition funnels through innovative use of technology.
* Define, measure, and act on relevant growth KPIs (CAC, LTV, conversion etc)
* Devising and executing comprehensive, repeatable, and profitable digital marketing campaigns.
* Create and implement launch campaigns, both digital and physical for each new site opening.
* Employing advanced analytics to refine marketing strategies and enhance user engagement.
* Leading the development and management of our website (and potential apps) and ensuring an intuitive user experience that aligns with visual design principles.
* Acting as the primary catalyst for our marketing initiatives, ensuring projects transition smoothly from concept to execution without reliance on external teams.



  





**We are looking for someone with** 



* 3-5 years of experience in a marketing or growth management role, preferably within a tech-focused environment.
* A solid track record in delivering measurable results in SEO, SEM, and online brand building.
* Creative thinking in terms of budgets and execution tactics.
* Proficiency in leveraging UI/UX principles to enhance customer interactions.
* A proactive and autonomous approach to workplace challenges.
* Strong ability to adapt and innovate under pressure.
* Excellent communication skills in multiple languages, with Swedish and English being essential.



  





 Join us to be at the forefront of redefining storage solutions and directly impact our strategic direction and operational success. Your expertise will not only drive our growth efforts but also shape the future of storage solutions in the housing market.

title: Lead Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineer
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact.
   

  

 Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.
   

  

 At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes*
**Join EQT and be at the forefront of AI innovation!**
 We are on the hunt for a Lead Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineer to build the next generation Motherbrain AI platform to enhance business processes at EQT. The Motherbrain AI platform is designed to integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) into business workflows and products, automating tasks such as summarization, data extraction, and analysis of internal & external data. The Motherbrain AI platform features enables the development of AI workflows with a focus on scalability, usability, traceability and support for domain-specific applications.
   

  

**About Motherbrain**
 Motherbrain, an integral team within EQT, integrates data science, machine learning, and AI into our investment strategy, offering a unique platform and opportunity to tackle complex, real-world challenges. Our team, sourced from leading tech companies, leverages the latest technology and collaborates closely with EQT's internal business professionals. This collaboration ensures that our innovative solutions significantly impact diverse sectors such as healthcare, technology, and infrastructure. Here, you'll discover an environment that fosters learning and growth, where your contributions influence tangible business outcomes and play a key role in EQT's global strategy.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Lead AI Engineer, you will have the unique chance to shape the future of the Motherbrain AI Platform. You will design and build AI-powered workflows to enhance developers productivity, thereby delivering and supporting strategic goals and have a lasting impact at EQT.
   

  

 You will be part of an inclusive, multi-cultural team that believes in the power of collaboration and will harness your unique personal and professional skills to build high-performing software and solutions.
   

  

 You will be working together with Data Scientists, Fullstack Engineers, Backend Engineers, Data Engineers, UI and UX Designers, and Business Stakeholders to take the Motherbrain AI platform to the next level and leverage AI as a core part of EQT’s strategy.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 This role requires an understanding on how to bridge the latest generative AI technologies and tools with the more established platform engineering practices covering the operational necessities of the entire lifecycle of an application. The key responsibilities of this role include:
   

  

* Lead the design, development, and maintenance of our AI platform, ensuring its high performance, reliability, and scalability.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features of the platform.
* Leverage LLM APIs, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLMOps, Agent Frameworks and related concepts to build cutting edge AI systems.
* Manage applications in GCP.
* Work with Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, and observability tools to ensure seamless deployment, traceability and scalability.
* Stay updated on the latest industry trends and technologies to keep our platform at the forefront of technological advancements.
* Ensure AI solutions adhere to ethical guidelines, data privacy regulations, and industry standards.


**Qualifications**
**Education**
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. PhD is not required for this role.
   

  

**Experience**
 Minimum of 5 years of experience in AI, machine learning, and software engineering, with a proven track record of deploying AI solutions in a production environment.
   

  

**Technical Skills**
* Technical Leadership: driving technological decision making and building relationships with stakeholders and other tech teams.
* Strong proficiency in writing production-grade Python software.
* Understanding of data structures, algorithms and design patterns for software and AI engineering.
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum).
* Understanding of FastAPI, REST, GraphQL, React and other tools used for backend and frontend integration.
* Solid understanding of security and privacy best practices when working with sensitive or proprietary data in AI systems.
* Experience with database technologies and data transformation pipelines (e.g. dbt, BigQuery, ElasticSearch, Redis, PostgreSQL, … ).


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with Platform Engineering, e.g. as an SRE or a similar role.
* Hands-on experience with LangChain and LangSmith for building and managing AI workflows.
* Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
* Practical experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
* Strong background in NLP techniques and tools, particularly for summarization, data extraction, and large-scale textual analysis.


**What's in it for me?**
 EQT is a well established company that has worked within its field for a long time. Being one of Europe's largest Private Equity firms you will get a stable employer, being proved by EQTs continued growth during the last years of market turbulence. Due to this, EQT offers attractive compensation packages, with an internal career framework giving you the opportunity to grow within the company. It also includes generous pensions, 6 weeks vacation and a great health care allowance. If you have small children, we also offer a domestic allowance program to enable a good work/life balance. There are of course more benefits on top of this, which we would be happy to tell you about when we meet.
   

  

**About EQT**
 EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 246 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌133 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does.EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,800 employees.
   

  

 More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram

title: Producer
job_function: Information Technology, Project Management, and Product Management
description:
Are you a product enthusiast with a potent blend of project management skills and a background as a product manager? Are you well-versed in agile methodologies and have a passion for the dynamic world of product development? If leading product development projects and turning cutting-edge ideas into tangible solutions sounds like your calling, you've found the perfect opportunity!
 



  





 NoA Ignite is a leading design and technology company that seamlessly blends business insight with engineering craftsmanship to create innovative digital solutions. With a team of over 400 digital strategists, designers, technologists, and data experts across offices in Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Poland, we are dedicated to delivering meaningful and measurable results for our clients.
 



  





**About the role** 




 At NoA Ignite, you'll step into the role of Producer—driving our product development forward together with talented tech and design teams. You’ll help shape ideas, plan the work, and make sure we deliver great results on time and within budget. This role is all about finding the right balance between client goals, user needs, and smart execution. If you're someone who blends a product mindset with hands-on project management and knows your way around agile ways of working—we’d love to talk!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead and oversee product development projects from inception to completion
* Forge strong relationships with clients, translating their visions into actionable plans
* Work hand in hand with tech and design leaders to plan and estimate project deliverables
* Work closely with international clients, translating their business needs into actionable plans
* Ensure projects align with agile principles, promoting flexibility, continuous improvement, and high-quality deliverables
* Draw from your product ownership background to drive the project's trajectory and make pivotal decisions
* Promote cross-functional collaboration, fostering a culture of innovation and tech-forward solutions
* Take charge in client projects, emphasizing quality and functionality at every phase



  





**Qualifications** 



* Ideally a background within project-, product management or similar
* Comfortable with the agile processes and ceremonies to be able to effectively manage teams across ideation, design and development
* Strong communication skills and able to translate business needs to tech and design (UX/UI) requirements and vice versa
* Working with clients from the sales cycle (pitching / estimating / selling), to the launch and SLA phase
* Excellent understanding of spreadsheets (Excel / Gsheets) for budgeting and planning
* Comprehensive understanding of mobile app and web development
* A sharp analytical approach complemented by top-tier problem-solving skills



  





**Our recruitment process** 




 There is no need for a personal letter or CV/resumé; provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions – that's it!

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 As Growth Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing innovative marketing campaigns across multiple channels. You will be a key player in shaping our Communications & Marketing strategy and will work closely with the Sales and Product teams to achieve our ambitious growth goals. A core focus of this role will be ownership of the company website and email marketing strategy.
   

  

**Responsibilities 💪**
 Develop and implement data-driven growth marketing strategies across various channels, in line with company strategy and departmental goals
   

  

* Website Ownership:
+ Own and manage the company website, including content updates, design improvements, and SEO optimisation.
+ Collaborate with our designers and developers to implement website changes and track website performance metrics (e.g., traffic, conversion rates, bounce rate).
+ Conduct UX research and testing to optimise website usability and conversion.

* Email Marketing:
+ Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, drive conversions, and improve customer retention - working in close collaboration with our Commercial team
+ Manage the email marketing platform and create automated email sequences.
+ Segment email lists and personalise email content to maximise engagement.
+ Analyse email campaign performance and optimise open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates.


  

  

* Lead Generation (Contact Acquisition & Enrichment):
+ Develop and implement strategies to acquire high-quality leads through various channels (e.g., webinars, contact lists, contact sourcing).
+ Implement contact enrichment processes to gather additional information about leads and improve lead qualification.
+ Research and evaluate lead generation tools and platforms.
+ Collaborate with the Sales team and target lead acquisition efforts accordingly.
+ Track and report on lead generation metrics, including lead volume, quality, and conversion rates.
+ Manage marketing budgets effectively and allocate resources strategically.
+ Collaborate with the other members of the Comms & Marketing to create compelling and engaging content that drives traffic and conversions.
+ Identify and evaluate new marketing technologies and platforms.
+ Stay up-to-date on the latest growth marketing trends and best practices.
+ Contribute to the overall Comms & Marketing strategy and brand building efforts.


**Qualifications 👑**
*What we need to see*
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in growth marketing or a similar role.
* Native or business level fluency in Swedish and English are a must.
* Experience in fintech/finance/banking/accounting is a must.
* Proven track record of developing and executing successful growth marketing campaigns.
* Strong experience in website management, including content management systems (CMS), SEO, and UX optimisation.
* Proficiency in email marketing platforms (e.g., HubSpot) and automation tools.
* Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
* Proficiency in various marketing platforms and technologies (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, CRM systems).
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* Creative problem-solver with a passion for growth and innovation.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


*What we’d love to see*
* Basic understanding of HTML and CSS is a plus.
* Proficiency in multiple languages and international marketing experience is a plus.


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Asana
* Hubspot
* Webflow
* Ad platforms
* Slack
* G-suite


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days, awesome!
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Digital analytiker för Sveriges Radio Play
description:
Är du en erfaren analytiker som vill bidra till att förbättra användarupplevelsen i Sveriges Radios digitala tjänster? Vi söker en erfaren analytiker som uppskattar att arbeta i team, nära produkten och är van att analysera användarbeteenden på digitala plattformar.
   

  

 Vårt mål är att erbjuda publiken en smidig och engagerande lyssnarupplevelse när vi guidar dem genom Sveriges Radios breda utbud av nyheter, poddar och kanaler.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar vi i team där alla medarbetare spelar en viktig roll. Vi tror att våra olikheter skapar den bästa dynamiken och leder till de mest innovativa lösningarna. Våra produkter ska spegla samhället och därför vill vi att vår arbetsplats gör detsamma. Fler röster leder till bättre beslut, mer trivsel och en arbetsmiljö där alla känner sig inkluderade.
   

  

**Om rollen**
**Som Digital Analytiker Hos Oss Kommer Du Att**
* Driva produktutvecklingen genom datadrivna insikter
* Samarbeta i team för att skapa den bästa digitala användarupplevelsen
* Bidra med analys och insikter under produktutvecklingens alla faser
* Delta i Product Discovery-processen
* Sätta upp och analysera experiment för att kontinuerligt förbättra produkten
* Arbeta tillsammans med våra UX-specialister för att jämföra och kombinera kvalitativa och kvantitativa insikter
* Dela med dig av din expertis genom presentationer, handledning och demos


**Vem du är**
 Vi tror att du är en analytiker med stort intresse för att skapa användarvänliga och stabila produkter. Du är ödmjuk, prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Du trivs i diskussioner där du kan påverka utvecklingen genom dina insikter och ser värdet i att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att nå gemensamma mål.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos Sveriges Radio får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en miljö där lärande och samarbete står i fokus. Vi anordnar designsprintar, arbetar med mobbprogrammering, kompetensutveckling och deltar i både nationella och internationella samarbeten. Du blir en del av ett företag som värnar om demokrati, det fria ordet och alla människors lika värde.
   

  

 Placeringsort i Stockholm där vi har vårt huvudsäte.
   

  

 Sveriges Radios uppdrag är att sända radio i allmänhetens tjänst och vi har 7,4 miljoner lyssnare i veckan. Över hälften av befolkningen tar del av vårt utbud i någon form varje dag. Antingen i direktsänd linjär radio eller on-demand, i FM, på våra egna digitala plattformar eller hos andra aktörer. Vi erbjuder trovärdig kunskap, fördjupning, sällskap och förströelse. Att jobba på Sveriges Radio innebär därför att du, oavsett roll, är en värdefull del i ett viktigt uppdrag.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Tjänsten som digital analytiker på Sveriges Radio är en tillsvidaretjänst på 100 % med start 1 maj eller efter överenskommelse. Du kommer att utgå från radiohuset i Stockholm.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av analys av digitala tjänster som appar och webb
* Relevant utbildning eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade genom erfarenhet
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: Kunskaper i SQL
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg som Power BI


**Frågor och kontaktuppgifter**
* Frågor om tjänsten: Anna Mogren Östlund, gruppchef, anna.mogren\_ostlund@sr.se eller 0708278655
* Fackliga kontakter: Unionen unionen@sverigesradio.se och 08-784 4819,  Journalistförbundet journalistklubben@sverigesradio.se och Saco saco@sverigesradio.se  Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IT Solution Architect
description:
**Description**


**We are looking for** an experienced IT Solution Architect to join Business Solution Team in Transformers Business Unit.

**Transformers BU** contribute to a reliable, sustainable and efficient generation, transmission and distribution of the electricity.

**Business** **Solution Team (BST) is responsible for** the successful execution of the Business Unit’s IT strategy and managing IT operations and applications across all Transformers manufacturing plants across the globe.

**IT Solution Architect will** lead the design and improve the IT Application Landscape in Europe Hub. We are on a growth journey, and you will one of the first few who will lead the design and improvement of our IT Landscape.


This is a unique opportunity to make a big impact our growing team and business results.

 **How you will make an impact:**

* **Architecture**: Design and implement the EU Hub IT Landscape in a very strong collaboration with Global Enterprise Architect and according to the Enterprise Architectural guidelines. Establish and maintain architecture guidelines and best practices for HUB to ensureconsistency and quality.
* **Solution Design:** Be the reviewer, approver and gatekeeper for all HUB Applications’ technical designs; approve and advise the vendor teams on application design.
* **Integration Design:** Design and support data integration development and optimizations of data flow processes to ensure efficient data ingestion, transformation, and delivery to analytics consumers. Place orders, approve designs and solution for all HUB Integrations
* **Non-functional Requirements**: Place major non-functional requirements to all technical designs. Monitor and optimize design performance to meet evolving business needs and minimize latency
* **Consultation to teams and projects:** Collaborate with stakeholders (IT and Business) to plan and implement optimizations for the legacy applications and new projects, including capacity planning, performance tuning, automation, and infrastructure upgrades. Provide technical consultations to application teams on best practices, and troubleshooting, review code developed by teams to ensure compliance with standards, identify potential issues, and recommend improvements.
* **Emerging Technologies:** Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in manufacturing, engineering and R&D domains to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.

**Your background:**

* **Education & experience:** Min. Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in IT Solution Design and Architecture. Experience from working on large scale projects
* **Area knowledge:** Very good knowledge of general IT principles and frameworks, Very good knowledge of different design patterns for Applications and Integrations
* **Tech experience**: 3+ years of experience in programming Java/.Net/C/C++/SQL/Python)
* **Working approch:** Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to lead indirectly (internal teams and vendor teams). Growth mindset and a willingness to learn new skills, technologies, and frameworks.
* **Soft skills:** Strong communication and collaboration skills
* **Preferred not manadatory experience**: Solution Architecture experience from manufacturing, engineering and R&D domains (preferred but not mandatory

**More about us:**

* **About Hitachi-** **http://www.hitachienergy.com/**
* **About Transformers BU** -**http:// https://www.hitachienergy.com/products-and-solutions/transformers**

**We offer:**

* **Contract of employment**
* **Hybrid/ remote work model**
* **Benefits:** We pride ourselves on offering a holistic range of competitive benefits to support your financial, physical and mental wellbeing and personal development. We want you to truly thrive with us, in work and out. We can provide more information during the recruitment process.
* **Growth possibility**: training budget & training platform, possibility to change the role within organization
* Possibility to gain / extend experience in international environment
* Possibility to work for industry leader in green energy solution


**Recruitment process:**

* Screening with recruiter
* Meeting with manager
* Offer (pre offer and offer stage- background/ reference check is moving to local HR )

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
