 Du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik/IT eller några års erfarenhet inom IT/teknisk support eller IT/teknisk projektledning. Du trivs med ett omväxlande arbete, har en hög servicekänsla och god samarbetsförmåga. Vi tror även att du gillar att jobba målstyrt och är bra på att ta egna initiativ. Viktiga förmågor i denna roll är nyfikenhet och en förmåga att identifiera och implementera förbättringar. Du uttrycker dig väl i tal och skrift på såväl svenska som engelska.
   

  

**Du Behöver Ha Några Års Arbetslivserfarenhet Av**
* Att driva effektiva utvecklingsinitiativ
* Att utföra behovsanalyser och konkretisera krav
* Prioritering av backlogg
* ITIL


**Hur Du Ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringsprocessen använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor och CV i stället för att be om personligt brev. Det gör vi för att säkerställa att rekryteringen blir kompetensbaserad och effektiv och att vi får samma viktiga information av alla kandidater. Urval sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 21/3.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Stockholm och start enligt överenskommelse. Vi kan komma att tillämpa 6 månaders provanställning. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Joakim Kjellgren chef SVT Support mejl joakim.kjellgren@svt.se. Fackliga frågor besvaras av Maria Nassikas Unionen, Jonas Ohlsson SJF och Fanny Lindhé SACO. Samtliga nås via växeln 08-784 00 00
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Business Support : Cisco Services & Software Purchase
description:
Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk och framåtlutad miljö där du får möjlighet att utveckla och optimera inköpsprocesser? Vi söker en engagerad och affärsdriven inköpare med fokus på Cisco Services & Software. Här får du chansen att arbeta i en spännande bransch där det innovativa tempot är högt och bidra till att säkerställa effektiva och lönsamma inköp.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi kallar rollen
 **Business Support** 
 och du kommer vara en nyckelspelare när det gäller inköp av Cisco Services & Software. Du kommer supporta affären med offertunderlag och olika rapporter och fungera som Contract Asset Manager för några av våra kunder. Du samarbetar nära säljspecialister andra i vår Cisco-affär och bygger starka relationer med både säljare, partners och kunder. Rollen ligger under Atea Technical Services, som är en del av affärsområdet
 *Atea Software Cloud & Services* 
 .
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter i rollen som Business Support**
* Utarbeta offerter och prisförslag för våra säljare och kollegor på inom Cisco support och mjukvara.
* Anskaffa support genom Ciscos system.
* Säkerställa att inköpsunderlag är korrekta och att informationen registreras korrekt i våra interna system.
* Assistera med att ta fram olika rapporter för våra säljare inom olika uppdrag.
* Fungera som Contract Asset Manager för vissa av våra kunder.
* Hantera leverantörsfakturor på en grundläggande nivå.
* Hantera och analysera inköpsdata för att optimera affären.


**Vem är du?**
 För att få bästa förutsättningar i rollen så besitter du flera av dessa egenskaper och kunskaper
   

  

* Strukturerad och noggrann.
* Stresstålig, då arbetet snabbt kan växla i uppgift och arbetsbelastning.
* Van att arbeta med Excel som arbetsverktyg.
* Du har god analytisk förmåga och ett affärsmässigt mindset.
* Du är noggrann och lämnar inte saken åt slumpen.
* Du har förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Du är kommunikativ och relationsskapande med god samarbetsförmåga.
* Prestigelös och ödmjuk, med en vilja att lära sig och dela kunskap.
* Du är flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

****Har vi väckt ditt intresse?****
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Stefan Claesson, Head of Customer Success & Technical Services, via stefan.claesson@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
   

  

 Vi hoppas på att få se din ansökan!
   

  

**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Cybersecurity Product/Demand Manager
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
In this role, you will be
 **responsible for the product and demand management activities** 
**related to** 
**Cybersecurity solutions** 
 , addressing requirements by Telia units and common needs from Telia countries, discussing technical solutions and clarifying needed aspects with related technical teams. You will work in an Agile way, within the Compliance and Cybersecurity Core Capabilities Agile Release Train (in short C4-ART), together with a team of talented experts in IT, Networks, GSOC and other units. You will have the opportunity to
 **drive the cybersecurity solution demand** 
 toward Product Owners and Agile teams appointed to develop and deliver systems and technical solutions. These teams work within the ART (Agile Release Train), following Telia's way of working that adheres to the SAFe framework.
   

  

**As a Cybersecurity Product/Demand Manager…**
 You will be responsible for Cybersecurity products development, collecting requirements from the stakeholders, shaping and communicating solutions, interfacing with experts, architects, and engineers, designing and discussing solution architectures, refining the demand to identify dependencies, breaking down work tasks, documenting clearly the work and supporting the drive of Product Increment planning. The main tools utilized at Telia for Agile deliveries include Jira and Confluence, and knowledge of these tools is a plus.
   

  

 You will join an exciting multicultural team within the Data Mediation and Cybersecurity unit, which, within Tech IT, is responsible for the development and operations of the Data Mediation and Cybersecurity systems at Telia Company. These systems are utilized across all Telia countries and domains.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For…**
 You should have experience with the IT delivery lifecycle, including demand and requirements analysis and refinement, solution architecture design, delivery, and testing. You should be familiar with the main Cybersecurity tools such as
 **SIEM** 
 ,
 **EDR/endpoint security** 
 ,
 **Vulnerability Detection** 
 and
 **scanning, NDR** 
 ,
 **SOAR** 
 and related standards, protocols, system integration, APIs. Knowledge of security operations and related tools and use cases, including the main phases like
 **Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond** 
 , and
 **Recover,** 
 is essential. You should also be knowledgeable about the main regulatory frameworks for EU Telcos like
 **NIS2, DORA, GDPR,** 
 etc. Some experience with
 **asset management/CMDB** 
 and
 **IAM** 
 is preferred. Additionally, you should have knowledge of cybersecurity applied to IT, networks, and Telco networks.
   

  

 You should be skilled in Agile methodologies, SAFe PO/PM, requirement and feature collection and refinement, project management, stakeholder management, and communication. You should be a team worker with a good collaboration attitude in multicultural teams. Being result-oriented, with a clear and persistent approach to achieving results while managing complexity and challenges, is crucial. You should have an open and transparent attitude, an analytic approach, good communication and reporting skills, and the capability to collaborate with stakeholders across different units.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 21/04/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to Massimiliano Pianigiani at massimiliano.pianigiani@teliacompany.com or Linkedin.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: ServiceNow Konsult
description:
Bli en del av vårt team som ServiceNow konsult och arbeta med varierande projekt inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Den röda tråden i de projekt vi tar oss an är att bidra till våra kunders nästa steg i deras unika digitaliseringsresa och tillföra samhällsnytta genom deras digitala transformationer!
   

  

**Din profil**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av ServiceNow ITSM modulen som system admin eller business process analyst.
* Bra förståelse av ServiceNow CMDB.
* ServiceNow-certifieringar som CSM eller HRSD är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och SAFe certifiering är meriterande.
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag & tjänstepension.
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar.
* Tech communities.
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee).
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.


**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Enterprise Arkitekt - Castra
job_function: Business Development, Consulting, and Information Technology
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som*
**Senior Enterprise Arkitekt**
 Vi söker en
 **Senior Enterprise Arkitekt** 
 som vill ta en ledande roll i att forma framtidens tekniska lösningar för våra kunder. I denna nyckelroll är du med och definierar strategiska arkitekturinitiativ som stöttar våra kunders affärsmål och långsiktiga strategier.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Senior Enterprise Arkitekt är du drivkraften bakom utformningen av en hållbar teknisk arkitektur som effektivt hanterar komplexiteten i våra kunders verksamheter. Du arbetar nära affärs- och teknikteam för att säkerställa att våra lösningar är både innovativa och väl förankrade i moderna arkitekturprinciper.
   

  

 Med en djup förståelse för tekniktrender och verktyg skapar du robusta lösningar som adresserar dagens behov och förbereder våra kunder för morgondagens utmaningar.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Leda arkitekturinitiativ som driver affärsvärde och teknisk innovation.
* Utforma och implementera skalbara, säkra och prestandaoptimerade lösningar.
* Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska strategier och arkitekturer.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturen följer bästa praxis och branschstandarder.
* Skapa tydlig och omfattande arkitekturdokumentation som stödjer beslutsfattande och implementering.
* Identifiera och hantera risker kopplade till tekniska lösningar och arkitektur.


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet**
* Djup kunskap inom moderna arkitekturprinciper och metoder.
* Erfarenhet av tekniska områden som nätverk, databaser, molntjänster, IT-säkerhet och integration.
* Relevanta certifieringar, t.ex. Sparx Enterprise, TOGAF, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, eller motsvarande.
* Stark analytisk förmåga att lösa komplexa problem och utforma praktiska lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och hantera flera intressenter.
* Kunskap om att bygga skalbara och prestandaoptimerade system.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-säkerhet och riskhantering.


 Låter detta i det stora hela som du? Tveka inte att höra av dig så tar vi ett möte redan kommande vecka!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm,Sundsvall, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@Castra.se

title: Teknisk Projektledare för Digitalisering och Automatisering
description:
Beskrivning
   

  

 Vår klient söker en engagerad och tekniskt kunnig person för att etablera en roll inom digitalisering med fokus på att optimera administrativa processer. I denna roll kommer du att ansvara för att identifiera och automatisera processer inom SSE, med hjälp av Microsoft Power Automate och Power Apps. Du kommer att driva projektet framåt samtidigt som du själv utvecklar lösningar inom dessa verktyg.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Kartläggning av processer: Identifiera och analysera nuvarande administrativa processer som kan förbättras och automatiseras.
* Utveckling av lösningar: Använda Microsoft Power Automate och Power Apps för att utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar som möter kundens specifika behov.
* Implementering och optimering: Säkerställa en framgångsrik implementering av automatiserade lösningar och kontinuerligt förbättra dessa genom att samla feedback och mäta prestanda.
* Uppföljning och utbildning: Ge support och utbildning till teamet för att säkerställa att nya system och processer används på ett effektivt sätt.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Förmåga att självständigt driva projekt och arbeta strukturerat.
* Djupgående erfarenhet och teknisk kunskap om Microsoft Power Automate och Power Apps.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att lösa tekniska problem.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera tekniska lösningar.
* God kommunikationsförmåga för att samarbeta med olika intressenter och säkerställa effektiv implementering.
* Mycket goda svenska kunskaper i tal och skrift.


 Villkor
   

  

**För att öka dina chanser att gå vidare i processen, uppmanar vi dig att uppdatera ditt CV och tydligt lyfta fram hur du uppfyller de specifika kvalifikationerna och kompetenserna för tjänsten. Med hög konkurrens är det viktigt att visa på din relevanta erfarenhet och hur du kan bidra till just det uppdrag vi söker.**
 Du kommer att anställas som konsult hos Q och arbeta heltid hos vår klient i Lindvreten.
   

  

 Q har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Almega, Tech Sverige samt i Svenskt Näringsliv. Företaget erbjuder interims- och rekryteringslösningar inom branscherna IT, teknik, administration, ekonomi, industri samt lager/logistik med personallösningar inom olika befattningsnivåer.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/244 | Publicerat: 2025-03-21 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-24

title: Quantitative User Researcher II
description:
We collaborate with Business, Product, Design and Tech across the entire user funnel, from onboarding and activating people to the platform to retaining existing users through meaningful product experiences and services. All of this in service of our mission to unlock the potential of human creativity—by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by it.
   

  

 As a member of our Product Insights team, you will join a group of highly motivated and passionate individuals, specializing in User Research, Data Science and Analytics Engineering. You will lead surveys to understand user needs, habits and behaviour across the user journey, and provide critical input when shaping compelling, user relevant offerings and experiences. This is a highly impactful role where you and the rest of the team will be able to directly impact how millions of Spotify users are supported around the world.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Identify opportunities for user research to address key business questions and inform new value propositions, product improvements or innovation across the user journey.
* Design and execute comprehensive research plans, including methodology selection, sample design and data collection, developing effective surveys that are aligned with research objectives and that meet quality standards.
* Analyze quantitative data from internal and external sources to identify key market and user trends, patterns, and insights.
* Inspire teams by employing a wide range of frameworks and storytelling techniques to communicate results and recommendations to business, product, design and engineering teams.
* Build trusted relationships with stakeholders to drive impact and translate insights into product improvements, new features and business strategies. Track the impact of research on business outcomes.


 Who You Are
   

  

* 5+ years experience of designing and executing surveys, working with statistical software and tools (e.g., SPSS, R, SQL, Python, Excel) to analyze data and generate insights.
* Excellent project management skills, leading research across all stages of the project
* A self starter, with a proven ability to turn ambiguous and unstructured questions into clear research objectives and plans
* An engaging storyteller and communicator, comfortable presenting complex information to a variety of audiences
* Thrive in a fast paced, highly collaborative, and international environment
* Passion for learning and growing in the field of quantitative user research and contributing to the practice within Spotify.
* Relevant experience in a consumer tech/product company is a plus


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: S/4 HANA Security and Control Consultants
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Deloitte's Technology & Transformation practice helps organizations effectively measure and mitigate risk and make informed and intelligent risk decisions around business processes, technology and operations. Our Technology & Transformation team has grown significantly over the past five years, both in Advisory and Assurance services.
   

  

 As part of our North and South Europe member firm, you will be joining over 1,100 cyber-risk professionals delivering world-class cyber-risk services across the region, a quarter of which is based out of the Nordics. Our inclusive culture forms the core of our firm – the reason why we can call Deloitte one of life’s greatest communities. We embrace and encourage authenticity and diversity of thought, as we understand that inclusion unleashes the power of our people – we understand that our diversity is a source of strength.
   

  

  





 You will be working on different projects in an international environment designing, implementing, upgrading and monitoring SAP authorization concepts. With the support of your team, you will guide the development of internal controls for our clients to achieve the required risk management level. Moreover, you will assist the client in setting up monitoring processes and tools to remain in total control of security in their SAP landscape and provide our clients with expert technical knowledge on SAP authorizations, good practice working methods and functional insight into the business drivers for Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) activities.
   

  

  





 You will play a key role on our team, collaborating with your team members to successfully deliver appropriate security solutions on multiple projects. We strive to create an environment where curiosity drives innovative solutions to our clients’ requirements.
   

  

  





 As we are expecting our local S/4 team to grow in coming years – you should be excited by the prospect of being part of building and developing the local business while still being closely connected and contributing to our community in the Nordics.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 As a skilled member of our S/4 and Cyber Risk team, we expect that you will be able to teach us something new, just as we are hoping to teach you something new. We are growing fast and are looking for strong consultants within a broad experience in the field of security and controls.
   

  

  





 You will essentially possess the following qualifications:
   

  

  




* You are an SAP security expert with 5+ years of experience from an advisory environment.
* You can design and implement best-practice SAP security blueprints, fit for the clients’ business frameworks. Essentially enabling technology to drive business transformations within Authorizations, Risk Management, Internal Controls, Information Security and Privacy.
* You are able to lead work for designing and implementing roles and access concepts, i.e. SAP Authorization Management and Hazardous Work Combinations (SoD).
* You have proven experience of implementing risk solutions in global companies using SAP solutions and the ability to assess business requirements, design solutions, produce functional analysis/technical documentation, and implement and test solutions.
* Security experience in S/4 HANA implementation and Fiori authorizations is a plus.
* You have experience of designing, configuring and implementing SAP GRC products, such as Access Control, Process Control and Business Integrity screening etc.
* You quickly understand the client environment and identify the client’s business requirements, building strong relationships.
* You have strong analytical skills combined with good communication and training skills.
* You can work independently, define targets and prioritize tasks in a complex and demanding environment.
* You can plan and execute a project to deliver a superior client experience. In addition, you can gain an in-depth knowledge of the client’s business and stay up-to-date on industry activities, marketplace trends, innovation efforts and leading practices.
* You are a team player who is committed, proactive, enthusiastic, flexible and eager to learn.
* You are willing to travel on a regular basis.


 To succeed in the role, you need to have an interest in both technical and organizational aspects of Cyber security, including ability to understand business contexts. As a consequence, you are able to communicate S/4HANA and Cyber with stakeholders both from the business and technology/IT. You have excellent language skills in English and preferably also Swedish.
   

  

 You are keen to share your experiences, motivate your colleagues and help developing the team and business. You are a relationship-oriented person with a drive and desire to deliver top quality service to your clients. Finally, you are a highly-driven team player who enjoys developing the business, solving problems and likes to take on new challenges.
   

  

  

**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 We can offer you access to our global AI & Data network of experts, a stimulating and supportive environment and a fantastic opportunity to help you take the next step in your professional career. You will also be part of a steep Nordic growth journey which in the future will open up for many new career opportunities within our Nordic firm.
   

  

  





**The way of working at Deloitte – our commitment to you**




 At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights, and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.
   

  

 Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals, and ambitions.
   

  

 We work together with our clients to help find the right solution and to help to apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we have started.
   

  

  





**How to apply**




 You apply online. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we are screening applications continuously and interviewing on a rolling basis. Please submit your CV, cover letter and university grades as part of your application.
   

  

 As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/
   

  

**Questions?**




 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Isha Garg, igarg@deloitte.se or Albin Finne, alfinne@deloitte.se. For questions regarding the role or application process, please contact Anna Cygnaeus, Talent Acquisition, at acygnaeus@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





**We are looking forward to your application!**




**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Data Platform Director
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Are you passionate about leading innovative data initiatives and shaping the future of a company where data will be central to its success?
   

  

 Join Mentimeter as our
 **Data Platform Director** 
 , where you will play a crucial role in expanding and guiding our Data Platform Team to achieve mission-critical business goals.
   

  

 At Mentimeter, our Data Platform Team is at the forefront of building data products and services that steer the company's strategic direction. As a pivotal part of our Data and Analytics organization—which includes AI, analytics engineering, data science, data analytics, and insights—the Data Platform Team collaborates closely with our Engineering and Tech Foundation organization. Here, you will develop a robust data ecosystem that supports various departments (Product, Marketing, Sales, and Finance) with both data and infrastructure. Your contributions will directly influence Mentimeter’s business and product decisions, driving us toward a data-driven future.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead and nurture a team of 5 data engineers to design, develop, and deliver modern data platform capabilities and data ecosystem for the company
* Collaborate closely with data engineers, data professionals, engineering leadership and business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into data platform capabilities
* Define roadmap and requirements for our data platform based on internal and external customer needs, business objectives and market trends
* Prioritize data platform capabilities and initiatives to maximize business value
* Guide the data platform team and engineering through enhancements of data flows across the data ecosystem
* Mentoring and coaching team members to improve skills and knowledge in relevant areas
* Develop and manage project plans, timelines, and budgets for data platform initiatives
* Ensuring compliance with data governance policies and security standards
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering, and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement


**We believe you have**
* 10 years of experience working with data engineering and data platforms, with at least 4 dedicated years nurturing and leading a team
* Strong understanding of data engineering concepts and technologies, including data pipelines, ETL/ELT processes, data warehousing, and cloud-based data platforms.
* Experience with agile development methodologies
* Great communication, interpersonal, and project management skills - you connect with team members and stakeholders, ensuring everyone is aligned and informed
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills enabling you to approach challenges with a thoughtful and solution-orientated mindset, including communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and adapt to changing priorities
* Ability to flourish in a dynamic, exciting, and fast-paced environment


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with AWS, Snowflake, DBT and product management experience


**Not Required**
* Swedish is not required (as daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts 50+ different nationalities)


**Not sure if you meet 100% of our qualifications?**
 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

*Please note that this role will have its base in our Stockholm office and is primarily an onsite role, with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.*
*Learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles*
**The Recruitment Process**
* Introduction interview - Meet TA rep and hiring manager for introduction interviews
* Competence interview - Meet the team for an onsite interview and conduct a live case exercise showcasing your relevant skills, technical knowledge and core strategic competencies
* Alva Labs tests - Conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* Culture & Leadership interview - Reflect more about our 5 core values and why you would be a great fit at Mentimeter


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Transformation Lead to Third Party Risk Management Services within Group & Business Services | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about risk management and eager to make a difference? SEB is looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic Transformation Lead to join our newly established Third Party Risk Management Services team. In this role, you'll drive capacity-building efforts across SEB, ensuring first-line accountability and widespread understanding of TPRM practices.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB!
   

  

**About the role:**
 You will be responsible for driving change management and spread knowledge of TPRM processes within the organisation. You will play a leading role in ensuring that TPRM practices are implemented in a structured and efficient manner and with supporting the business in their TPRM work.
   

  

**Among other responsibilities, you will work with:**
* Lead initiatives and change management activities to strengthen SEB’s continuous improvement of TPRM practices.
* Develop and deliver engaging training programs tailored to TPRM processes, lifecycle activities, and third-party risk tiering.
* Foster first-line accountability through enhanced awareness, capacity building, and collaboration with Divisions, Subsidiaries, and Group Functions.
* Design innovative educational materials, tools, and workshops to ensure widespread understanding of TPRM practices.
* Act as a center of excellence, promoting cross-collaboration and knowledge sharing across SEB as well as identifying areas for improvement and driving awareness and change management initiatives that align with organizational goals.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Education, Business Administration, Risk Management, Organizational Development, or a related field.
* Certifications in training design and delivery (e.g., Certified Professional in Training Management - CPTM) are a plus.
* You have a proven track-record in driving transformation & change on senior level
* Proven experience in fostering organizational awareness and accountability within a complex and regulated environment.
* Experience collaborating with diverse teams across multiple divisions, subsidiaries, or functions.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills to engage and educate stakeholders at all levels of the organization and the ability to simplify complex concepts and adapt messaging to different audiences.
* Strong understanding of third-party risk management frameworks as well as familiarity with governance and regulatory requirements (e.g., DORA) related to third-party risk management


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of a newly established team and be part of deciding the strategy for the team’s mission to strengthen SEB’s third-party risk management practices.
* An empowering and dynamic work environment where you can drive continuous improvements in the TPRM process and framework to ensure compliance and resilience.
* Opportunities for continuous learning, professional development, and career growth within a leading financial institution.
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week and attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Apply by attaching your CV and a cover letter that highlights your relevant skills and experience and how they align with the role.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-04-04. If you have questions about the position, please contact Isabel Ringsby, Head of Third PartyRisk Management Services via email at isabel.ringsby @seb.se.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**If you know someone who would be a great fit for this role, please share this opportunity with them.**
 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Head of Business Operations (m/f/x) - Nordics
description:
To strengthen our
 **Commercial Organization** 
 , we are currently hiring a
   

  

 Head of Business Operations (m/f/x) - Nordics
   

  

 (Fulltime / permanent / Location: Danderyd)
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Join our team as the Head of Business Operations in Sweden and drive the success of our innovative healthcare solutions. This critical role involves leading a team focused on Demand Planning and Product Supply, Customer Service and Distribution, and Operational and Commercial Excellence. Your goal will be to enhance processes in these areas, contributing to the achievement of ambitious revenue goals for the region.
   

  

**The Role**
* Lead and manage a diverse team of professionals, fostering a high-performance culture and promoting individual growth and development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to align strategies and ensure effective implementation, inspiring the future and ensuring team buy-in.
* Oversee the product demand and supply process, ensuring monthly updates with all business areas and European/Global planners, and maintaining a solid product supply situation.
* Manage the Nordic supply chain.
* Identify and prioritize service improvement opportunities and create plans for implementation, building bridges and proactively improving cross-business collaboration.
* Interact with distributors across the Nordic region.
* Develop strategies and recommendations for improving processes, efficiency, and practices, leveraging current and future IT systems.
* Develop a state-of-the-art performance and commercial excellence strategy.
* Develop and implement salesforce effectiveness data, sales operations policies and procedures, and best practices to ensure compliance and consistency across the organization, in cooperation with the Head of Sales.


**Your Skills And Experience**
* University degree, preferably in business, data management, science, or engineering.
* 5+ years of experience in Demand Planning/Product Supply, Operational Management, Data Management, and Commercial Excellence.
* Experience with digital marketing generated from CRM systems.
* Knowledge of PowerBI or similar systems is beneficial.
* Fluent in both spoken and written English.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and preferably also Veeva/Salesforce as a CRM system.
* High digital and adoption skills for new technology are highly valued.


**Reporting Relationships**
* Reports to: General Manager – Nordics
* Direct reports: Customer Service Specialist, Regional Demand Planner, Sales Coordinator, Business Operations & Tender Analyst


**What We Offer**
* Comprehensive benefit plan with options including medical plans, life insurance, and retirement plans.
* Two additional leave days for your personal wellbeing.
* Learning opportunities with our CSL Academy.
* Find Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion at all sites and with every colleague. Come as you are.


 Join us and contribute to making a difference in the lives of patients with rare diseases. Apply today!
   

  

**Our Benefits**
 We encourage you to make your well-being a priority. It’s important and so are you. Learn more about how we care at CSL.
   

  

**About CSL Behring**
 CSL Behring is a global leader in developing and delivering high-quality medicines that treat people with rare and serious diseases. Our treatments offer promise for people in more than 100 countries living with conditions in the immunology, hematology, cardiovascular and metabolic, respiratory, and transplant therapeutic areas. Learn more about CSL Behring.
   

  

**We want CSL to reflect the world around us**
 As a global organization with employees in 35+ countries, CSL embraces diversity and inclusion. Learn more about Diversity & Inclusion at CSL.
   

  

**Do work that matters at CSL Behring!**

title: Internal Control Director
description:
**Shape the future. Bring your potential to life.**
 At Electrolux, we are on a mission to shape living for the better. By creating innovative solutions and meaningful experiences, we aim to enrich people's daily lives while supporting the health of our planet. Our goal is to be a driving force in defining enjoyable and sustainable living, and we are now looking for an Internal Control Director to join our journey and lead the Internal Control Team.
   

  

 Reporting to the Head of Group Internal Audit, you will provide strong leadership and strategic direction, ensuring the continued development of both people and deliverables in line with group standards. In addition, you will work to strengthen the collaboration and communication between Group Internal Audit and our Business Areas, helping us align efforts and achieve shared goals.
   

  

 With our ambitious growth, we need strong, visionary leaders to guide us forward. This is a significant role on a truly international stage, where your expertise will help shape the future of Electrolux.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the leader of the Group Internal Control Team, you will be responsible for overseeing the Electrolux Control System (ECS) Program Management Office. You will proactively drive improvements in the methodology and execution of the ECS, the Group’s internal control program for financial reporting, while ensuring effective collaboration with both our external auditors and key internal stakeholders.
   

  

 To continuously improve the internal control environment at Electrolux, several key initiatives are already underway or planned. These include:
   

  

* Enhancing SAP application controls and increasing control automation
* Updating Segregation of Duties (SoD) matrices and related system tools
* Improving testing methodologies and implementing a new GRC tool for ECS
* Supporting the future SAP S4/Hana upgrade to improve the control environment, which may impact the current framework
* Designing and implementing internal controls for sustainability reporting, in line with upcoming CSRD requirements


 As the Internal Control Director, you will be responsible for driving and managing these initiatives, collaborating with both internal and external resources and experts to ensure their successful execution.
   

  

 As a strong people leader, you will foster a highly motivated and competent team while driving continuous quality and efficiency improvements in internal control processes. You will also be responsible for preparing regular reports on ECS status, progress, and findings for the Audit Board and Audit Committee.
   

  

 In collaboration with the rest of the Group Internal Audit management team, you will identify and implement ongoing improvements in internal audit and internal control processes, methodologies, and supporting functions within the department.
   

  

**Who you are:
   

  

 A Leader** 
 - You have a vision and a purpose, and you can inspire and influence others to not only share it, but apply their abilities to achieving it.
   

  

**Collaborative** 
 - You build networks and trust, good working relationships and apply your influence to shaping change.
   

  

 Communicative - Whether face-to-face or virtually, you can communicate plans and articulate your ideas with colleagues at all levels.
   

  

**Analytical** 
 - With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, prioritize and translate this into meaningful, useful management information.
   

  

**Agile** 
 - Both reactive and proactive, you work efficiently and flexibly, to deliver results. A fast thinker with ability to pick up and treat new information rapidly.
   

  

**Expert** 
 - You not only know your area of expertise, you are passionate about it and understand how it can enable and support people to work better and achieve more.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Professional with a minimum of 10 years work experience in a multinational organization
* Solid experience of working in internal/external auditing or internal control/Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) program management, for large/complex international companies
* SAP and application controls expertise
* Experience with controls rationalization and automation is an advantage
* People leader with proven ability to motivate and develop teams.
* Skilled business partner with strategic perspective and exceptional judgement.
* Adept at managing stakeholders and leading through influencing
* Strong communication skills
* Master’s degree in Economics, Finance, or a related field is required.


**Where you will be based:**
 You will be based at Electrolux Headquarters in Stockholm.
   

  

**Some of our benefits include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment;
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services;
* Family-friendly benefits such as extended paternity leave (4 weeks);
* Insurance policy plan;
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

title: Business Developer – Natural Resources
company_industry: Construction, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Civil Engineering
description:
**What's The Role**
 The Business Developer is a technical sales role, forming part of the global Hilti Business Development community. You will create a strategy and lead its execution to increase adoption of Hilti solutions. You will play an important role, coordinating with local and global teams associated with these accounts. As a Business Developer you will proactively develop business opportunities through a selected portfolio of accounts and project involved in Natural Resources industry. Your main focus will be on Owners, EPC and Consultant accounts operating in the segment. Your aim will be to develop and grow your business by providing state of the art technical service, engineering consultancy and multi stakeholder technical solutions.
   

  

**Who is Hilti?**
 At Hilti, we are a passionate global team committed to making construction better. As a trusted partner for productivity, safety, and sustainability, we provide our customers innovative solutions that impact the buildings, roads, and infrastructure people rely on every day.
   

  

 Hilti is where individuals grow lasting careers by exploring possibilities, maximizing their potential, owning their development, and making a real difference every day.
   

  

**What does the role involve?**
 In the role you will be responsible and accountable for:
   

  

* Development of Owner, EPC and Consultant accounts operating in the segment through account standardization, project specifications and solutions, sales development (direct or indirect) and multi-level relationship management.
* Developing the strategy of the assigned accounts and segment game plans. Leading your strategy upfront with internal stakeholders such as local direct sales teams and global segment experts.
* Building and having ownership of segment project pipeline identifying largest business opportunities for Hilti in selected projects.
* Together with local sales teams, creating and implementing the strategy for most important brownfield sites for ongoing maintenance and upgrade projects.
* Proactively build-up and participate project and account capture teams to drive the aligned focus solutions, increase share of wallet and ensuring projects are executed as planned from design to construction.
* Bringing market intelligence inputs to the teams to confirm and/or update segment strategies.
* Maintaining effective communication throughout the team and the company
* Act as owner of assigned accounts.
* Drive and will to interact and meet with customers in person - finding solutions together
* Flexibility to travel within Sweden – Mining sites and related facilities located up north whereas petrochemical sites and offices in south.


 Responsibilities includes travelling abroad when needed and you will spend about 50% of your time travelling. The position is preferably located in Stockholm, but other locations could be discussed.
   

  

*For more than 10 years, Hilti Sweden has proudly been on the list in the Great Place to Work survey of Sweden's best workplaces in the category large organizations.*
**What do we offer?**
 Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.
   

  

**What you need is:**
* Previous experience with working on Industríal Construction projects and ideally MSc/BSc degree in commercial, mechanical or civil engineering.
* Business development/sales experience for engineered products or sales of technical solutions.
* Excellent communication skills and creation of trust through active listening.
* Working in matrix organization - influencing via leadership, not via authority.
* Long-term strategic thinking with capability of explaining and transmitting the targets & strategy to customers, peers and management. Ability to plan a week, a month, a year in accordance with the strategy.
* Ability to influence internal and external stakeholders around the strategy while understanding external stakeholders’ pain points and trends to adjust when needed.
* Ability to work self-driven and autonomously by creating own planning and tasks to reach the targets.
* Skill of identifying, understanding and delivering sharp, high-level system selling value proposition and readiness to go into the details.
* Senior relationship management: Capable and confident while speaking to senior and C-level customers.
* Project management capabilities: Manage complexity of system selling across multiple geographies, functions and customers.
* Networking skills (internal and external) with confidence while working within a matrix


**Who should apply?**
 We have an excellent mix of people and success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Hiring Manager Teemu Rissanen, teemu.rissanen@hilti.com. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Business Partner Sara Henriksson, sara.henriksson@hilti.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Virtual Account Executive-Sweden
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**
 Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.
   

  

 We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.
   

  

 Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.
   

  

 Virtual Account Executive is sales professional focused on acquiring and developing business within assigned territories and verticals, while looking for new logo prospects and developing existing accounts. Candidates will effectively be spending 70% of the time on active selling and 30% on supporting tasks such as network quotes, agreeing conditions with partners and other tasks related to sales.
   

  

**Virtual Sales Tasks**
* Acquire new logo business, build strong pipeline.
* Actively seeks out and develops new customers, new opportunities.
* Proactively contacting the existing clients to maximize business potential – active upsell/cross sell .
* Engaging with new leads provided by Operations Team, maximize MQL conversion into real opportunity
* Generate new sales leads and opportunities
* Acquisition and developing own customer portfolio – direct touch with end users is requirement
* Provide consistent interaction with existing customers – upsell/cross sell initiatives
* Ensures that information about new products, services, and operational changes are communicated to customers on a timely basis
* Maintain and builds account relationships.
* Represents the Company at industry trade shows and conferences – travel requirements is a must


**Other Tasks**
* Manage the day to day client meetings.
* Maintains all information about customers, including all contact information and call reports, accurately and timely in CRM (Salesforce).
* Managing the jobs from quotation stage to booking in line with the client expectations and communicating effectively any service issues.
* Manage and follow-up on quotes.
* Internal liaison with the operations team assisting with quotations and service information.
* Reporting activities to the country manager
* Strong Swedish language skills

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
*Are you an experienced HR professional passionate about making a meaningful impact on both people and business? Do you excel at building relationships and serving as a trusted advisor to drive individual and organizational growth?* 




  





*Our HR team is seeking a People Partner who focuses on operational excellence together with a strategic approach and is eager to explore diverse opportunities for personal and career development. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!* 




  





**Who we are** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as a top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity, and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing across Europe, currently with 11 active international offices.
 



 As a network organization, our way of working is based on leveraging competence, allowing us to benefit from our collective expertise, beyond the ability of the individual. Netlight is built on trust and self-leadership!
 



  





**Your future team** 




 Our global HR organization includes 25+ colleagues across HR, Payroll, and Learning & Development. Join our dynamic HR Operations team of seven professionals at our Stockholm office, located atop Gallerian.
 



  





 As a key member of our team, you'll help shape the future of HR, driving HR core deliveries, growth and success in an environment built on collaboration, development and trust. You'll work closely with colleagues across the Global HR Team to ensure alignment and advance key initiatives.
 



  





**People partner** 




 Working in HR at Netlight requires a strong business sense and exceptional relationship-building skills, as you'll be part of a fast-paced, ever-evolving, and people-focused organization.
 



 As a People Partner, you will drive operational HR excellence across the employee lifecycle, taking on a broad range of responsibilities, including:
 



 • Managing employee relations and enhancing the employee experience throughout their journey.
 



 • Coaching, advising, and training leaders on key personnel topics—such as work environment, performance, well-being, and labor law—to empower them in their roles.
 



 • Supporting talent management initiatives to help our people reach their full potential.
 



 • Ensuring HR policies and processes align with our overall people strategy.
 



 • Driving efficient global HR practices while ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations.
 



 • Managing and developing partnerships related to employee well-being and benefits.
 



 • Leading employee engagement efforts, including surveys and initiatives to assess and improve organizational well-being.
 



 • Handling people data across the employee lifecycle within our HRIS.
 



 • Utilizing People Analytics to analyze and share key insights that support informed decision-making and business strategy.
 



  





**Your profile** 




 We are looking for an HR professional with an open and creative mindset, eager to learn and apply their experience to Netlight. You will thrive in this role if you enjoy working collaboratively, take initiative, and are committed to both personal and professional growth.
 



 In addition, we value:
 



 • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to navigate complex HR challenges.
 



 • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build trust and influence at all levels of the organization.
 



 • A proactive and solution-oriented approach to driving HR initiatives forward.
 



 • An understanding of HR best practices, employment laws, and compliance.
 



 • The ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining a people-first mindset.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 • University degree with focus on Human Resources or similar education
 



 • Broad experience within the HR field and 2+ years of full-time work experience within a similar role; employee life cycle, advising leaders, developing processes and guidelines etc.
 



 • You communicate fluently verbally and in written form in Swedish and have a professional level of English, as English is our organizational language.
 



  





  





**What we offer** 




 • The possibility to be part of and drive a wide array of HR and business topics in an international environment.
 



 • Competence development and long-term career progression realized through a culture of knowledge sharing, feedback, external courses, mentorship and coaching.
 



 • A top modern and centrally located office space in Stockholm (Urban Escape on top of Gallerian).
 



 • Social- and competency developing internal events.
 



  





  





**We should also mention parts of our comp & ben package:** 




 • 5000 sek / year in health care benefit (“friskvård”)
 



 • Private pension savings
 



 • 30 days of paid vacation
 



 • Employee Assistance Program
 



 • Parental Top Up
 



 • Everything you need to do your magic (computer, phone, mobile subscription)
 



  





  





**Interested?** 




 The role is a full-time position starting as soon as possible or based on your availability.
 



 Send in your application in English or Swedish, including your CV and a few words on why you are interested in this position by submitting your application on our website, please make sure that your CV and introduction are in the same document.
 



  





 Interviews are ongoing so send in your application as soon as possible. Your application will be reviewed, and we will get in touch within 2 weeks if we find that your profile matches our requirements.
 



  





 We are looking forward to reading your application!

title: Lösningsarkitekt till vårt Salesforce-team
description:
Om du motiveras av att arbeta med Salesforce-arkitektur i spännande transformations- och tillväxtinitiativ - har du nu chansen att forma framtidens IT-lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder!!
   

  

 Vi gör våra kunder till experter, och ser till att de själva både kan leda och bygga framgångsrika verksamheter. Vi gör detta möjligt genom att hitta den bästa lösningen, så att kunderna kan nå sina mål: Vi motiverar, optimerar, implementerar, överför kompetens och följer med kunden på deras resa.
   

  

 Som senior lösningsarkitekt kommer du att ha det övergripande ansvaret för de lösningar vi erbjuder våra kunder. Du kommer att vara både rådgivare och ansvarig för den tekniska lösningen och ha en nyckelroll i våra projekt.
   

  

**Vi Tror Att Du Trivs Med Att**
* Ta ansvar för den övergripande arkitekturen i den lösning vi erbjuder våra kunder och vara en nyckelspelare i teamet
* Bidra genom hela projektet: från erbjudande och business case, analys, integration och utveckling hela vägen till implementering och leverans till löpande underhåll
* Vara rådgivare och sparringspartner för våra kunder
* Arbeta nära i team med driftiga och kompetenta kollegor
* Kommunicera den valda lösningen och rekommendationerna med projektledning och utvecklare
* Identifiera och implementera strategiska förbättringsområden hos kunden


****Vem är du?****
 Vi tror att du är en passionerad och kreativ problemlösare som vill bygga lösningar som har effekt för våra kunder. Du gillar att omvandla affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, och ser till att dessa används. Du är nyfiken, och vill bidra till att bygga vår starka yrkesmiljö ytterligare genom engagemang, delaktighet och bra leveranser i våra projekt.
   

  

**Har Du En Eller Flera Av Följande Meriter**
* Magisterexamen eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av och stort intresse för att arbeta med Salesforce
* Konsulterfarenhet - god kommunikationsförmåga och en relationsbyggare
* Erfarenhet som utvecklare och/eller konfiguratör med intresse av att arbeta med lösningsarkitektur och rådgivning


****Du kan förvänta dig att:****
* Ha kul och känna dig stolt över vad du och hela Stretch bidrar med
* Vara med och bygga framtidens företag
* Motiveras av ett driftigt team med mycket hjärta
* Bli en del av en skandinavisk och professionell Salesforce miljö
* Få stort utrymme för din nyfikenhet att driva utvecklingen


**Och lite om oss**
 Stretch Customer är teamet med branschens bästa Salesforce konsulter.
   

  

 Det är den sköna känslan vi lever med i teamet varje dag. Tillsammans triggar vi varandra att hela tiden göra lite bättre. Med stor nyfikenhet kommer innovationer och lösningar som utvecklar vår affär med Salesforce.
   

  

 Vi hoppas få berätta mer om vad vi erbjuder dig!
   

  

 Hälsar
   

  

 Stretch Customer teamet

title: Natural Resources Underwriter_ Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.
